texts.en: Maridel, aged 23, is married to a company laborer and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store for almost one year.  In this business she earns a net income of PHP 200 a day.  Her profits are usually spent on food allowances and her children's necessities.  Due to the lack of capital to utilize for her business, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase chips, food seasonings, biscuits and beverages to sell. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve more of her business.

loans.use: to purchase chips, food seasonings, biscuits and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Jumdah

texts.en:
Jumdah is 38 years old and married with four children.

Jumdah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like charcoal, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from raising cattle and farming coconuts.

Jumdah aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like charcoal, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Juraita

texts.en:
Juraita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, mineral water, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Juraita has been in this business for four years.  Juraita earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Juraita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, mineral water, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her buy and sell fish business.  Ligaya is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc for her general store business.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store and from raising pigs. Lolita is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Nom

texts.en: Nom is 52 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 per day. Two of her children are employed as garment workers. They earn about $10 daily. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Nom is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her children earn higher education. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her house’s roof.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Wendi

texts.es:
Wendi, de 64 años de edad, es viuda y vive con sus hijos en su casa propia  . La actividad que realiza Wendi en la venta de comidas para el almuerzo. Para atender a sus clientes  cuenta con 2 mesas y sillas que instala  en el frontis de su casa, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su hija.  También vende bebidas gasificadas heladas  y golosinas  en su casa propia. Iniciándose en ambos negocios hace más de 06 años. Le gusta su actividad pues cuenta con un ingreso económico, además de estar en la comodidad de su casa.  Se siente una persona  productiva y le distrae,  tiene regular clientela que se supo ganar con el transcurso del tiempo.  Desear continuar con su negocio y crecer aun  más. Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva, Está muy contenta de  saber que cuenta con un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de víveres e ingredientes para la preparación de menús como arroz, aceites, pollos, carnes, verduras y otros.
texts.en:
Wendi, 64, is a widow and lives with her children in her own house.  Wendi's job is selling lunch with the help of her daughter.  To serve her customers she has two tables and chairs that she set up in the front part of her house.  She also sells cold carbonated beverages and sweets in her own house.

She got started in both businesses more than six years ago.  She likes this job because she has an income and she works in the comfort of her own home.  She feels like a productive person and she has fun.  She has regular customers she learned to attract over time.

Wendi wants to continue with her business and grow even more.  This is her third loan with Kiva.  She's very happy to know she has some financial help because this way she'll feel certain of making progress with her business.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

Wendi will invest the entire requested amount of 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN] in provisions and ingredients to make meals, including rice, oil, chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en: Savoeun is 42 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over two years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 daily. One of her children is also employed in a garment factory and earns about $4 each day. To improve her family’s finance, Savoeun is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cattle to breed and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to purchase farmland to use for farming and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and resell

loans.name: 03.05.13 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ has a retail business selling general items. Huệ has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase general things such as milk, sugar and candy to sell. With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

Huệ is 49 years old and she is married with three children. Huệ lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her children are grown up.

This is Huệ first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Huệ is the group leader of the 03.05.13 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of six members.

loans.use: to purchase general items such as milk, sugar and candy to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 35 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Mercy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mercy has been pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Fely works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Fely is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, coconut, and soap for her general store business.

Fely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell for her general store business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Elsie has been in this business for 8 years. Elsie earns more income from raising pigs.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lorelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Lorelyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, Milo drink mix, noodles, soap, shampoo, chips, bread, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business even more.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, Milo, noodles, soap, shampoo, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Tynarkan

texts.ru: Тынаркан 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Все дети школьного возраста. Учатся в школе, в свободное время помогают Тынаркан по хозяйству, Тынаркан гордится своими детьми, так как дети растут умными, послушными и заботливыми. У Тынаркан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Тынаркан занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Супруг активно помогает Тынаркан  по хозяйству. Вместе они заготавливают корма. Благодаря упорному труду Тынаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тынаркан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Тынаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку холодильника.
texts.en:
Tynarkan is 43 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising four children. All the children are school-aged. They go to school, and in their free time help Tynarkan around the homestead. Tynarkan is proud of her children, since they are growing up intelligent, obedient and loving.

Tynarkan has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Tynarkan raises livestock, having begun 20 years ago with a livestock purchase for 6,000 som KGS. Her husband actively helps Tynarkan around the homestead. Together they succeed with the feeding. Thanks to her hard work, Tynarkan currently has on her homestead: three dairy cows. Monthly income consists of 5,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Tynarkan applied to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to purchase cows for expanding the count of cattle.

Tynarkan plans to invest income from the loan to further propagate the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Jiydegul

texts.ru: Жийдегул 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Все дети школьники почти погодки, все дружно учатся в местной школе. У Жийдегул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жийдегул занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 7,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жийдегул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров. Супруг наемный рабочий, работает на заказ. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жийдегул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жийдегул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку стиральной машинки.
texts.en:
Jiydegul is 35 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising five children. All the children are in school, close in age, and together at the local school. Jiydegul has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Jiydegul raises livestock, having started 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 7,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Jiydegul currently has on her homestead: five dairy cows. Her husband is a hired worker, working on order. Monthly cumulative income consists of 3,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Jiydegul turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy sheep for increasing her livestock count.

Jiydegul plans to invest income from the loan to further propagate the quantity of livestock, and plans to save money to purchase a washing machine.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Butimba Group

texts.en:
Christina is married and a mother of four children, two boys and two girls. All of them are in school. She is in her late 30s and is currently running a shop selling clothes. Christina has been in this business for seven years now. She works from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm every workday and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This is her sixth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use the loan to buy business clothes to resell. With her previous loans, she managed to purchase more sold-out clothes for her business.  She has paid back all her previous loans successfully. She used her profit to pay school fees and house hold expenses and saved the remains. Christina dreams to become a successful business person. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "BUTIMBA," which consist of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business clothes to resell.

loans.name: Luzel

texts.en:
Luzel is 31 years old and married with children. She works hard to provide for her family. Luzel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

Luzel has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending. Luzel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like noodles, canned goods, sugar, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Lucia has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs. Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like noodles, canned goods, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Maria Lita

texts.en:
Maria Lita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 24 years now.

Maria Lita requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net. In the future, Maria Lita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Mariam works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling cassava. Mariam is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, shampoo, milk, soap, canned goods, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Mariam has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, shampoo, milk, soap, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Donaldo

texts.es:
Donaldo es un campesino del oriente antioqueño, a sus 38 años de edad, se desempeña como productor lechero, actividad que aprendió de la mano de su padre y que ahora le permite generar recursos para solventar las necesidades del hogar. La producción del líquido blanco es vendida a un vecino que posee tanques de frío y así ha logrado ganarse la vida durante los 12 años que lleva desarrollando la labor.
El crédito que solicita es una alternativa para fortalecer su actividad, ya que con el dinero desea comprar dos vacas productoras de leche, con el ánimo de incrementar su producción y mejorar los ingresos, así podrá hacerle frente a los desafíos que se le presentan por los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas y por la inestabilidad en el precio de venta del producto.
Donaldo manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo su labor y aumentar su capacidad de producción mínimo con 20 vacas productoras, así podrá tener una estabilidad económica favorable y mejorará la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Donald is a farmer from Eastern Antioquia, at 38 years old, he works producing milk, a job that he learnt hand in hand with his father, which now enables him to make the income to pay for his family’s necessities.

The fresh milk produced is sold to a neighbor who owns cooling tanks, and this is how he has been able to make a living during the 12 years he has spent doing this work.

The loan he is asking for is an opportunity to be able to strengthen his work; with the loan money he wants to buy two dairy cows with the intention of increasing production and improving his income. This will help him face the challenges presented by the high costs of the farming supplies and fluctuations in the price of his product.

Donaldo says that his greatest desire is to continue strengthening his work and increasing his productive capability with at least 20 productive dairy cows, therefore being able to have favorable economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Arlex

texts.es:
Arlex es un hombre trabajador y dedicado a su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus 3 hijos.
Se ha ganado la vida a pulso, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado dar sustento y educación a sus hijos; trabajando arduas jornadas como empleado en diferentes oficios; pero, hace un año, decidió independizarse y montó su propio negocio, un almacén de venta de ropa y artículos para niños y bebés; la idea surgió de la necesidad de generar mejores ingresos y estar más tiempo con su familia; por lo que aprovechó la oportunidad y la ventaja de ser el único en ofrecer estos artículos en el municipio; por lo que ha tenido muy buena acogida en el municipio, pues le evita a sus clientes que se desplacen a la ciudad a conseguirlos; así ha generado los ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar durante el año que lleva su negocio en funcionamiento.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (ropa, juguetes, biberones, pañales, entre otros), esto le permitirá mejorar las ventas, ya que ofrecerá más alternativas a sus clientes, aumentando así el margen de utilidades que percibe con su labor.
Todo esto le permitirá avanzar para cumplir su mayor anhelo; pues Arlex sueña con adquirir su casa propia para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y garantizar a sus hijos un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Arlex is a hardworking man and is dedicated to his family, which is made up of his wife and their 3 children. He has earned a living through his own hard work. With a lot of effort, he has succeeded in supporting and educating his children, working difficult jobs as an employee in different fields.

However, one year ago, he decided to go out on his own, and he started his own business - a store that sells clothing and products for children and babies. The idea came out of a necessity to generate better earnings and have more time with his family. Therefore, he took advantage of the opportunity and good timing to be the only one offering these items in his city. Because of this, he has had an excellent reception in the city, as it saves his customers having to leave town to get these things. In this way, he has made enough income to pay for his household expenses during the year that his business has been in operation.

With the intention of strengthening his business and offering a greater variety to his customers, he is requesting the support of the loan to purchase supplies in bulk (clothing, toys, bottles, diapers, among others). This will allow him to improve his sales, since he will offer more alternatives to his customers, thereby increasing the profit margin that he gets from his labors.

All of this will enable him to move forward in order to fulfill his greatest desire: Arlex dreams of purchasing his own house in order to offer his family a better quality of life and guarantee his children greater well-being.

loans.use: to purchase supplies in bulk (clothing, toys, baby bottles, and diapers, among others).

loans.name: Diego Alexander

texts.es:
Diego es un joven activo, trabajador y con una mente emprendedora que está en constante búsqueda de opciones para mejorar la calidad de vida.
Nació y creció en el seno de una familia humilde campesina que, encontró en las labores agrícolas una alternativa de vida, razón por la que aprendió a desarrollar todas las tareas del campo y, hoy en día le permite generar ingresos por cuenta propia, con sus cultivos de maíz, cuya cosecha recolecta y vende en el mercado del pueblo donde reside; adicionalmente trabaja como jornalero en diferentes fincas de familiares y vecinos.
Con su espíritu de superación y con el ánimo de complementar los ingresos para su familia, a sus 22 años, desea iniciar una pequeña chaza, para lo cual adaptó un pequeño lote de la casa donde reside, razón que lo impulsó a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido inicial al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, cerveza, licores, productos de panadería, entre otros) y además comprará insumos agrícolas para reabonar sus cultivos de maíz y preparar la tierra para la próxima cosecha; esto le permitirá poner en marcha su nuevo proyecto productivo y además mejorará la producción de sus cultivos con los cuidados pertinentes; así generará mejores ingresos para apoyar la economía del hogar.
Diego, como todo joven, tiene sueños y aspiraciones, por lo que lucha incansablemente, pues desea ampliar sus cultivos y tener bien surtida su pequeña tienda, para garantizar una estabilidad económica favorable que le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida y bienestar en su núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Diego is an active, hardworking young man with an entrepreneurial mindset, who is constantly looking for ways to improve his quality of life.  He was born and raised in a humble agricultural family.  Agricultural work was a way to make a living so he learned all of the different tasks in the fields and today he is able to make his own money with corn crops that he harvests and sells in the town market where he lives. He also works as a day laborer on various farms that belong to relatives and neighbors.  With his spirit of constant improvement and a desire to contribute to his family's income, at the age of 22 he decided to start a small retail stand on the lot where his house is. For this reason he is requesting a loan to purchase his initial inventory wholesale (snacks, soft drinks, beer, liquor, baked goods, etc.).  He will also purchase agricultural products to fertilize his corn crops and prepare the land for the next harvest.  The loan will allow him to start up his new business and improve his plants' output with the appropriate care.  He will earn more income to help out his family.  Diego, like all young people, has hopes and dreams, and fights for them tirelessly.  He wants to expand his crops and have a well stocked little store to guarantee economic stability that will allow him to improve his living conditions and the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: To purchase inventory wholesale (snacks, soft drinks, beer, liquor, baked goods, etc,) and to purchase agricultural products to fertilize his corn crops and prepare the and for the next harvest.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann works hard to support her family. Mary Ann is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials like wood, nails and bamboo for the maintenance of her fishing boat. Mary Ann has been in this business for eight years now. She would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, nails and bamboo for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Tomebamba  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Tomebamba está conformado por 9 mujeres y 1 hombre quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza arquitectónica y natural, es cuna de grandes deportistas y escritores, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen viva su cultura y tradiciones. Las socias se esfuerzan para mejorar su economía y su meta principal es entregarles a sus hijos mejores oportunidades para que salgan adelante y triunfen en sus vidas.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Elena, tiene 49 de años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos, su primer hijo tiene 27 años de edad, trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, su segundo hijo tiene 14 años y estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo labora como carpintero, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña María Elena pasa en casa al cuidado de su familia y también se dedica a la agricultura y cría cuyes y pollos a los que los vende en la ciudad. Hay días que le llaman para que labore en la limpieza de casa. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, pollos y materiales de construcción para arreglar su casa. Su sueño es tener un local propio en donde pueda vender verduras y hortalizas.
texts.en:
The Tomebamba Communal Bank is made up of nine women and one man who live in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its architectural and natural beauty; it is the home of great athletes and writers; its people are kind, courteous, and maintain their culture and traditions.  The bank members work hard to improve their finances and their main goal is to provide their children with opportunities so they can get ahead and succeed in their lives. 

One of this group's members is María Elena.  She is 49 years old, married, and has two children.  Her first son is 27 years old and he works and helps with the household expenses.  Her second son is 14 and he goes to the local school.  Her husband works as a carpenter and they own the house they live in.  

María Elena cares for her family at home and she also works in farming and raises guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells in the city.  Sometimes she gets calls to do housecleaning work.  

She will use her loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and construction materials to work on her home.  Her dream is to have her own shop where she could sell vegetables.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and construction materials.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима родилась в 1979 года. Она добрая и жизнерадостная женщина. Фотима разведенная и имеет одного сына. Его зовут Азизбек. Фотима уже много лет работает уборщицей в университете. Она не имеет высшее образование и поэтому работает уборщицей. Она всегда мечтала получить высшее образование. Фотима и ее сын не имеют собственного дома. Они живут вместе с родителями Фотимы. Дом ее родителей чень старый. Фотима хочет отремонтировать дом родителей, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Fotima was born in 1979. She is a kind and cheerful woman. Fotima is divorced and has one con. His name is Azizbek.

Fotima has worked for many years as a charwoman in a university. She does not have a higher education and therefore works as a charwoman. She always dreamed of receiving a higher education.

Fotima and her son do not have their own home. They lives with Fotima's parents. Her parents' home is very old. Fotima wants to do repairs on her parents' house, but does not have the money. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, paint and the like for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, and paints for repairing her house

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: El señor Ignacio tiene 36 años de edad es soltero y no tiene  hijos, vive en casa de sus padres y les ayuda en lo que puede, estudio hasta nivel primario y  por falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar con sus estudios, por esa razón empezó a trabajar desde muy joven, ayudando a sus padres y vecinos en sus  cosechas, actualmente él tiene sus propios lotes de cítricos y chirimoya, pero le falta dinero por ello solicita un crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos para mejorar su producción, e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Ignacio is 36 years old, single, and has no children.  He lives at his parents' home and he helps them as much as he can.  He went to primary school, but because of a lack of money he was not able to continue his studies. Instead he started to work at a very young age, helping his parents and neighbors with his harvests.  He currently has his own citrus and cherimoya fields, but he needs money, which is why he is requesting a loan to maintain his crops so they will have a better yield and his profits will increase.

loans.use: to maintain his citrus and cherimoya crops

loans.name: César Augusto

texts.es:
César, a sus 41 años de edad, se desempeña como operario agrícola en un cultivo de flores, pero con el ánimo de complementar los ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida familiares, desea alternar su empleo con la actividad ganadera, razón por la que solicita el crédito; con el dinero comprará terneras de levante para dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto productivo; cuenta con la ventaja de poseer espacio suficiente en la finca familiar donde reside; allí contará con el apoyo de su esposa y su hijo para el cuidado de los animales, mientras él cumple con su horario laboral.
César es un campesino nato, nació y creció en el seno de una familia humilde que durante generaciones se han dedicado a las tareas agropecuarias como alternativa para ganarse la vida y así, por herencia, él aprendió y ahora transmite sus conocimientos a su hijo de 18 años; para construir con él un negocio familiar próspero que les permita tener mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar y, en un futuro a mediano plazo estar en la capacidad de independizarse totalmente y disfrutar más de la compañía y el amor de su esposa e hijo.
texts.en:
César is a 41-year old farming worker who works in the cultivation of flowers. He wants to earn additional income to improve the quality of life of his family and has decided to combine his job with stockbreeding. This is why he is requesting the loan, which he will use to buy young calves to start his project. He has enough space for this in the family ranch where he lives and will also count on the help of his wife and son to take care of the animals while he's working. 

César is a natural farmer. He was born and raised in a modest family that has made a living from agriculture for generations. He learned from them and now teaches his 18-year old son. His aim is to set up a successful family business that will provide them with better quality of life and welfare. In the medium-term, he plans to work in his business only and enjoy more the company and love of his wife and son.

loans.use: to buy young calves.

loans.name: María Alix

texts.es:
María, a sus 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo adolescente al que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación.
Es una mujer pujante y trabajadora, siempre busca alternativas que le permitan salir adelante, a pesar de todas las adversidades que la vida le ha impuesto.
Actualmente se dedica a la confección, oficio que aprendió de una amiga y por medio de diferentes cursos de capacitación a los que ha asistido, así se ha ganado la vida para dar sustento y educación a su hijo, quien se ha convertido en el motor de su vida. Confecciona todo tipo de modas que sus clientes le encargan y, en algunas ocasiones realiza maquilas para algunas empresas que solicitan sus servicios.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, botones, hilos, accesorios, cierres, entre otros), esto le permitirá ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y así mejorar su producción y el margen de ganancia por cada venta.
María tiene como propósito la ampliación de su negocio a mediano plazo, para generar oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida y bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria, at 35 years old, is the single mother of a teenage son who has gotten ahead with great effort and dedication.

She is a strong and hardworking woman, always looking for opportunities that will enable her to get ahead, in spite of all the adversities that life has imposed upon her.

Currently she works in dressmaking, a trade that she learnt from a friend and through various training courses that she has attended. This is how she has made a living to be able to support and educate her son, who has become the driving force of her life.

She sews all types of clothing that her clients request, and on some occasions, she does assembly work for several companies which request her services.

With the aim of strengthening her business, she is asking for a loan to be able to buy wholesale materials  (fabric, buttons, thread, accessories, zippers, etc.). This will enable her to offer more variety to her customers and thus improve her production and profit margins for each sale.

Maria’s intends to expand her business in the medium term, to be able to make opportunities for employment and to improve the quality of life and wellbeing of her son.

loans.use: to buy wholesale materials (fabric, buttons, thread, accessories, zippers, amongst others).

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
Ket is 41 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She is a housekeeper. Her husband is a fisherman who makes an income of $3 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $8 each day. 

Due to lack of funds, Ket is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase a plot of land. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to take another loan to build a house on the land she buys and help her children pursue higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Sophat is 26 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a security guard who makes an income of $4 daily. To improve her farming business, Sophat is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase fertilizer, rice seeds and fuel to use for cultivating. In the future, she would like to build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, rice seeds and fuel to use for cultivating

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. Alma earns additional income from farming rice.

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, and eggs for her food vending business. Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, and eggs

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Analyn works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish and raising pigs. 

Analyn is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net and other fishing materials for her business. Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is a married woman with seven children. She is 51 years old and has one child who is still in school. Estrella is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a banana vending business in the Philippines. Estrella requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell. She has been in this business for 9 years. Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ena works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ena is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like charcoal, soap, shampoo, rice, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business. Ena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like charcoal, soap, shampoo, rice, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina tiene 37 años, es casada y vive en Monteagudo con sus cinco hijos que aun dependen de ella, tiene casa propia y trabaja desde su domicilio, se dedica a la costura y/o confección de ropa de vestir y deportiva. Todos los días trabaja arduamente para mantener a su familia pero lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir todos sus gastos, actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima (telas, hilos) y una maquina over lock para confección de prendas, de esta forma podrá incrementar su trabajo y por consiguiente obtendrá mayores ingresos, para otorgarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Cristina is 37 years old. She is married and lives in Monteagudo with her five children, who are still dependent on her. She has her own house and she works from home; she works sewing and making regular clothes and sports clothes.

Every day she works very hard to support her family, but her earnings aren't enough to cover all of her expenses. Now, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of basic material (fabric, thread) and an overlock machine for making garments. In this way, she will be able to increase her work, and therefore, she will get more earnings to offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase basic material (fabric, thread) and an overlock machine for making garments.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old and has a live-in partner and three children. With two children still in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, snack foods, noodles, bread, and coffee.  

Elizabeth has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Annie Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Annie Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Annie Fe is borrowing 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like vegetables, spices, eggs, etc., for her food-vending business.

Annie Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like vegetables, spices, eggs,. etc

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosela has been in this business for two years now.

Rosela has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients like hotdogs, chorizo, and chicken for her business. In the future, Rosela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like hotdogs, chorizo, and chicken for her business

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo crédito para fortalecer el negocio y darle mantenimiento a su molino, invertirá en la compra de golosinas, fajas y gasolina para el molino, al surtir su negocio atraerá muchos clientes nuevos y atenderá bien a los que ya tiene.
Con el capital que se le proporciono antes el compro variedad de productos, sus ventas aumentaron, cancelo sus deudas, mejoro su economía con lo que ha podido construir una galera en el patio de su casa.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan to strengthen his business and perform maintenance on his mill.  He will invest in candy, belts, and gasoline for the mill.  Stocking his business will attract many new customers and will provide good service to the ones he already has. 

He used the money he was previously awarded to buy a variety of products.  His sales increased; he repaid his debts; his finances improved; and he was able to build a chicken coop on the patio of his house.

loans.use: to buy candy, belts, and gasoline for his mill

loans.name: Elorde

texts.en: Elorde is 49 years old, and he is a farmer. He aims to improve his farming business; that's why he is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy seeds, insecticides and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes that through this amount of loan, he could obtain an abundant harvest and greater income, which will serve his family's welfare and the improvement of his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides and fertilizer for his rice farmland

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the needed grocery items for her variety store. Her loan is also helpful for the education of her child, who is in grade school. Her income from business is assisting their everyday expenses at home. She also has a canteen for additional income. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for a new 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Joy hopes that her business will improve and dreams that all her children will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke (entertainment) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine for her videoke (entertainment) business.

Arlene has been in this business for five years. Arlene earns more income from pig fattening.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 35 years old. She is married and has five children, who are in school.

Beverly is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Beverly has been farming sugarcane for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, etc for her food vending business.

Elma has been in this business for 10 years. Elma earns additional income from raising pigs and farming rice.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nicolás Antonio

texts.es:
Nicolás, a sus 53 años de edad, es un hombre con ganas de salir adelante y superarse. Ha pasado por muchas dificultades económicas y emocionales que le han dado una lección de vida; tenía su propia empresa de fabricación de colchones y colchonetas en espuma y algodón, pero, por inconvenientes que tuvo con la bebida alcohólica llevó a bancarrota su microempresa y su vida amorosa, pues su esposa también lo abandonó. Hoy en día, ya rehabilitado y renovado, comenzó nuevamente con su oficio, gracias al apoyo de un conocido que le presta las máquinas de coser y un espacio en un local por un bajo precio de arrendamiento, así ha podido reconstruir su economía y sus ganas de salir adelante. 
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, algodón, espuma, hilos, entre otros), esto le permitirá cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes con algunas empresas que confían en su labor y conocen sus productos; esto le dará la opción de seguir avanzando para llegar a cumplir su principal anhelo que es reabrir su propio taller; pues Nicolás manifiesta que sería la mejor oportunidad que la vida le podría brindar, con la que desea darse a conocer por la calidad de sus productos y aumentar los ingresos que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Nicolás, at the age of 53, is a man with a desire to get ahead and overcome. He has experienced many economic and emotional difficulties in his life that have given him a life lesson. He had his own company making mattresses and mattress pads from foam and cotton, but due to issues that he had with alcohol, his small business and his love life failed, as his wife also left him.

Today, rehabilitated and renewed, he has begun again with his job, thanks to the support of an acquaintance who lends him the sewing machines and space in a business at a low rental cost. In this way, he has rebuilt his finances and his hopes to get ahead.

Currently, he is requesting the support of the loan in order to purchase wholesale supplies (fabric, cotton, foam, and thread, among others). This will enable him to make good on pending payments that he has with some companies that trust his work and know his products. This will give him the option of moving forward to fulfill his main desire of reopening his own shop, as Nicolás says that this would be the best opportunity that life could offer him. With it, he wishes to become known for the quality of his products and increase his earnings, which will enable him to improve his living conditions and well-being.

loans.use: to purchase supplies in bulk (fabric, cotton, foam, and thread, among others).

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $1000.00 loan is being offered to Maria to improve her business. She is married, has two children, and has a mini shop where many customers come every day. Maria will buy some additional stock such as trousers, shorts, shirts, long-sleeved shirts, short-sleeved shirts, and T-shirts. She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Maria independent--she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shorts, shirts, long-sleeved shirts, short-sleeved shirts, and T-shirts

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila, age 40, is a hardworking housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband services shelters. Jamila is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Jamila hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Sakeena is a 32-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 2 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, so he has been unable to generate any income. He wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the repair costs. Therefore, Sakeena has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the costs. This will help him to continue his business. Sakeena is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Savriddin

texts.ru: Савриддину 25 лет. Он муж и отец двоих дочери. Он со своей семьей живет на районе Яван, там же он начинает свою деятельность, свой маленький бизнес. Савриддин успел приобрести будку, где он в нем сам будет продавать сим карты, аксессуары и запасные части для телефона. Сзади него находится три будки и один их них, будка Савриддина. Он только нашел место для продажи, но еще не приобрел товар. Он просит кредит, чтобы купить сим-карты и дополнительные устройства для мобильных телефонов. Савриддин с надеждой ждет Вашей помощи!
texts.en: Savriddin is 25 years old.  He is married and the father of two daughters.  He lives with his family in the Yavan district of Tajikistan, where he is currently starting his own small business. He has managed to purchase a booth in which he will be selling SIM cards as well as phone components and accessories.  His booth is one of the three booths visible in the photo, behind him.   However, although Savriddin has already found a retail space, he hasn't purchased any merchandise yet.  He is taking a loan to purchase SIM cards as well as cell phone accessories.  He is eagerly awaiting your help!

loans.use: to buy SIM cards and cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 62 years old and married with six children.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, sugar, etc.

Gloria has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Gloria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia works hard to support her family. Porferia is married and has a business where she buys and sells bananas in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of bananas to sell.

Porferia has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
This is Herminia, 51, a resident of Tagiug, Philippines. She is married to Asterio, an aircraft mechanic, and she is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Herminia operates a house rental business. The property is rented on a monthly basis. She also has a direct selling business for additional income. She earns a minimum of 20,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will be using the loan for the repair and maintenance of her apartment.

Herminia dreams of expanding her business and improving their way of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of her apartment.

loans.name: Dorteia

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is being offered to Dorteia to improve her business. She is married with four children and she opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital.  She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like fish, noodles, sugar, salt, cigarettes, coffee and water. She is generating a good income from selling. 

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family. Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: To buy fish, noodles, sugar, salt, cigarettes, coffee and water to sell

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
This is Jennelyn, 29, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rouel, a mason, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jennelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Jennelyn dreams to be successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 46 years old and weak. Her husband sells ground spices with the help of his son. He purchases spices, grinds them using a blending machine and packs the flour in polythene bags to sell. A few days ago, the belt of the blending machine broke during the grinding process, which stopped all of his business operations.
 
Shahida wants to take a loan for her husband to buy a new belt and more stock of spices. The blending machine is the only way to grind the spices and her husband wants to repair it immediately.
 
Most of the time, Shahida suffers from diseases and part of their income is spent on a cure. Shahida and her husband have grown old and they are worried about the future. 

Shahida hopes that they will save a sufficient amount to live their lives smoothly.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her spice grinding equipment

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 42 years old and married with three children.

Cecelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, coffee, milk, rice, etc., to sell.

Cecelia has borrowed and repaid 30 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Cecelia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, coffee, milk, rice, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mirgul

texts.ru: Миргуль 31 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Миргуль - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Миргуль занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Миргуль очень ответственная, пунктуальная и предприимчивая женщина, умеющая вести хозяйство и вкладывать деньги в нужное русло. Благодаря упорному труду Миргуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Миргуль обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку одной лошади и 5 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Миргуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Mirgul is 31 years old, married, and the mother of four children, whom she raises with her husband.  She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started in this business eight years ago, with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS).

Mirgul is a very responsible, punctual and ambitious woman who knows how to run her farming business and where to invest her money.  Thanks to her very hard work, she now owns four dairy cows and ten sheep.  She makes a monthly income of 11,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her farming business, Mirgul has requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners".   She will use her loan to buy one horse and five sheep and therefore increase her livestock headcount.

Mirgul plans to re-invest the profits from this loan back into her business by purchasing additional livestock. She is also planning to save enough money to continue to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy one horse and five sheep.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 36-year-old, hardworking woman. She is living with her husband and four children. Her husband is the only person in the family earning an income. He owns a restaurant in the main market. He delivers quality food in the market, like chicken, vegetables, meat, etc. 

Presently, he needs to purchase food items like oil, spices, chicken and a variety of vegetables to cook food to sell. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Shagufta has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She wishes to provide a quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to cook and sell.

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
Norman is 27 years old and from the western part of Kenya. He supports three people in his family and is a married man. They have two children who are two and five years old, respectively.

He operates a motorcycle transport, a business he has been doing for the last three years, and generates a monthly income of 20,000 KES.  

He has applied for his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya that he will use to do some repairs.  He will use the anticipated income to stabilize the product. His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: to do repair on his motorbike

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants de 35 et 32ans, Adjovi revend depuis 2001 des produits alimentaires dans une boutique. Elle est aidée par 01 personne et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de garder sa clientèle. Elle espère avec le profit se soigner et aider ses arrières fils.
texts.en: Mother of two children who are now 35 and 32 years old, Adjovi has been selling food products in a shop since 2001. She has one person helping her and requests a first credit to buy more stock in order to retain her customers. With the profits she hopes to take care of herself and to help her great grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Tene

texts.fr: Revendeuse d'habits et sacs au marché, Téne est mère d'un enfant de 15ans scolarisé. Elle est à son troisième crédit à WAGES et cela lui servira à s'approvisionner en marchandises vue que les fêtes de fin d'année s'approche. Elle espère agrandir son activité et assurer l'avenir de sa famille.
texts.en: Téne sells clothing and handbags at the market and has a 15 year old child who attends school. This is her third loan from Wages and it will be used to stock up on merchandise for the year's end celebrations which are getting closer. She hopes to enlarge her business and ensure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy clothing and handbags.

loans.name: Basile Noe

texts.fr: Basile est un homme de 34 ans, célibataire et père d'un enfant d'un an. il est commerçant et ouvert une alimentation dans un quartier de la capital qu'il gère depuis 10 ans. son activité fonctionne bien grâce à la bonne qualité de se produits, son accueil chaleureux et aux bonnes relations avec son voisinage. Il sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter le stock des produits de première nécessité dans sa boutique (sacs de riz, cartons de savons et d'huiles). ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes, mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité et le reste l'aidera pour sa famille.
texts.en: Basile is a 34 year old man who is single and has a one year old child. He is a shopkeeper. He opened a grocery in a district of the capital that he has been running for 10 years. His business is doing well due to the quality of his merchandise, his warm welcome, and his good relations with his neighbours. He requests this loan in order to increase the stock of staple products in his shop (bags of rice, boxes of soap and oil) this will not only increase his sales, but also his profit margin. This profit will be partly re-invested in his business and the remainder will help him care for his family.

loans.use: To increase his stock of staple products.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma sells clothes to his neighbors and passersby.  He faces a major challenge of stiff competition in his business. He dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that he is requesting of Kes 10,000, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale to add stock to the business. he decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and he appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale to add stock for the business

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en: Veronika appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu at large. The previous loan helped her to buy clothes to sell. .She intends to add stock to the business and so, she is requesting for a loan of KSHS 20,000 to buy skirts, t-shirts, shirts and baby wares to sell.

loans.use: to buy skirts, t-shirts, shirts and baby items to sell

loans.name: Abeleine

texts.fr: Abeleine est une femme de 32 ans, célibataire mère d'un enfant. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale ou elle ouvert un petit comptoir dans lequel elle fait un petit commerce général à savoir : savon, stylos, brosses, cigarettes et autres....son activité fonctionne bien avec la clientèle qu'elle a conquise et fidélisée au fil du temps. elle a un problème dû à la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à faire écouler tout ses produit pour se réapprovisionner. C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter deux cartons de savons, cartons de stylos, javel, cigarettes et autres...ceci augmentera ses ventes ainsi que son bénéfice. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera pour sa famille
texts.en: Abeleine is a 32 year old woman who is single and has one child. She is a saleswoman in a market in the capital where she has opened a small counter where she sells convenience products, for example: soap, pens, brushes, cigarettes and other things…her business is doing well with a clientele that she has won over and retained in the course of time. She has a problem due to the smallness of her capital which means that she must sell all her merchandise before she can stock up again. This is why she requests a loan to buy two boxes of soap, boxes of pens, bleach, cigarettes and other things…this will increase her sales and her profit. She will use the profit partly to re-invest in her business and the remainder will help her care for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Bunyaruguru Savings And Credit Co-Operat

texts.en: Greetings from Uganda! This is Byaruhanga (holding on to the solar lamp). He is the Manager of Bunyaruguru Savings and Credit Co-operative (SACCO). With him in the photo are members of Bunyaruguru SACCO's management. Bunyaruguru SACCO is one of the oldest Savings and Credit Co-operatives in the Bushenyi district of Western Uganda and has been providing financial services to members of the local community for over 13 years. The majority of Bunyaruguru SACCO's 3,300 members are low-income farmers who grow bananas, beans, nuts and maize. As well as providing financial services, Bunyaruguru SACCO is interested in being able to provide life-enhancing products to its members. Only 2% of houses in the local area have access to electricity, which means that many of the SACCO members spend a large portion of their income on firewood and kerosene to meet their energy needs. Bunyaruguru SACCO has therefore requested a loan to buy solar lights and energy-efficient cookstoves to sell to its members.

loans.use: to purchase energy-efficient cookstoves and solar lights to sell to its members.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 1 1/2 years, Janet has been working hard to manage her bakery business, which sells chapatti and donuts. 

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more baking flour and firewood for making chapatti and donuts to sell.  This will help Janet to generate greater profits, take care of herself, and grow her business. Janet hopes that in the future she will be able to get established in a bigger way. 

Janet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more baking flour and firewood for making chapatti and donuts.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She does not have children. For the past one year, Mary has been working hard to manage her business, which sells local brew. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet, firewood, pots and straws, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and take care of her young siblings. Mary hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a bigger brewing place. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more millet, firewood, pots and straws.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 17-years-old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has 0 children. For the past year, Doreen has been working hard to manage her small business, which brews the local drink. 

To help expand her business, Doreen has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet, firewood, pots and straws that will be used in the process of making the local brew, and will help Doreen to generate greater profits and take care of her other basic needs.  Doreen hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a very good bar with a restaurant. 

Doreen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more millet, firewood, pots and straws that will be used in the process of making the local brew.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the region of Kampala East in Uganda. He is divorced and has 3 children. For the past 10 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his metalwork business, which sells off scrap and does blacksmithing. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a motorcycle for the business and add inventory, which will help Joseph to generate greater profits and improve on the family income. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to meet customers' expectations. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his business and add inventory.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 42 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, with two of them currently in school. For the past four years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells various home items. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items to sell, and will help Patrick generate greater profits, improve on the standards of living, and pay school fees for his children.He hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential items to sell

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemi vive en casa de unos familiares  en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de comerciante de cosmeticos. Noemi necesita el crédito para el aumento de su capital de trabajo para comprar más cosméticos y así poder obtener mayores ingresos y poder cubrir  los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Noemi es terminar sus estudios superiores ya que ella actualmente esta estudiando sociologia
texts.en:
Noemi lives with relatives in a brick house with a cement floor in the area of Bajo Llojeta in the city of La Paz.  She sells cosmetics for a living and is requesting a loan to increase her work capital and buy more cosmetics.  This is so she can earn more income and cover her household expenses.

Noemi's goal is to finish her degree in Sociology.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to improve her income.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a twenty eight year old married woman with two children living in Bundibugyo,Uganda.She buys cocoa from gardens and sells it to wholesale agents since 1999. Her future plan is to expand her business into a big cocoa store in town and also to ensure that her children get high level education.She faces a problem of seasonal changes affecting her profitability. 

Scovia is requesting the loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man who comes from a remote area in Nsungu- rural Ibanda. He deals in cattle and goat fattening and trade. He has been in this business for 15 years and it has helped him to educate his six children. He has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy cows and goats. He is targeting the Christmas season for higher sales. He hopes to expand his business and cash flow because he has plans of constructing a permanent home for his family. Francis has many customers because he is honest.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a businessman and runs a motor vehicle repair business in town and the business has been doing fine. He found out about Milango through friends, who invited him to join so that he could save and be able to access funding for the business. He now seeks a loan to buy a sander, a router and a jigsaw machine. He sees his business growing so that he can be able to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a sander, a router and a jigsaw machine.

loans.name: El Cruce Hacia El Futuro  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito El Cruce hacia el Futuro está formado por 10 mujeres quienes viven por la parroquia de Sinincay en Cuenca, lugar que tiene una hermosa iglesia como atractivo turístico, goza de varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno. Su gente es amable, gentil y sobre todo trabajadora ya que día a día luchan para mejorar su estabilidad económica y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora María de Lourdes, está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus vecinas y amigas que conforman el grupo de crédito El Cruce hacia el futuro, fue invitada por una amiga y vecina y su anhelo es poder superarse y a su vez estrechar más los lasos de amistad con todas las socias.
La Señora María de Lourdes tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 10, 8 y 5 años que están estudiando en la escuela del sector, su esposo labora en su carpintería, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.
Doña María de Lourdes trabaja en su casa en el taller de su esposo y como es una profesional en el área de la costura se dedica a fabricar y realizar todo tipo de arreglos de prendas de vestir. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de telas y en el pago de una letra de una máquina de coser que adquirido. Su sueño es agrandar su taller de costura.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Cruce hacia el Futuro" is comprised of ten women who live in the Sinincay Parish in Cuenca, a place with a beautiful church as a tourist attraction.  The place has several nature sites and its architecture mixes the old and the new.  The local people are kind, gentle and hard-working as they struggle daily to improve their economic stability and give their children a better future.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.
