One of the members of the group is María de Lourdes who is taking out her first loan together with her neighbors and friends in the communal bank.  She was invited to join the group by a friend and neighbor.  Her desire is to get ahead and deepen her friendship with all the members.

María de Lourdes is 35 years old, married and has three children, ages 10, 8 and 5, who attend the local school.  Her husband is a carpenter.  They rent the house they live in.

María Lourdes works from home in the workshop her husband has.  She is a seamstress makes and mends all kinds of clothing.

She will use the loan to buy fabrics and pay an installment on the sewing machine she bought.  Her dream is to expand her sewing business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and pay an installment on a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jeanne Marie Chantale

texts.fr: Jeanne est une femme de 38 ans célibataire mère de 2 enfants donc l'âge varie entre 12 et 7 ans. elle est une grailleuse de poisson. dans un marché de la place. elle rencontre des grandes difficulté dans la quantité de sa marchandise qui est insuffisante par rapport a la demande de sa clientèle. à cet effet elle a opté de venir auprès de nous solliciter un crédit. Grâce a ce crédit elle va pouvoir satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, réinvestir et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Jeanne is a 38 year old single woman who has two children between the ages of seven and twelve. She  prepares fish at a local market. She has a lot of difficulty in having sufficient merchandise to satisfy the demand of her clientele. For this reason, she decided to collaborate with us and request a loan. This loan will enable her to satisfy the demand, re-invest, and take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy fish and tools.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
José, disfruta de su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus dos hijos de 4 y 3 años, es casado, vive junto a su familia. Como actividad económica tiene una panadería, trabaja todos los días de 6:00 a 10:00 a.m. y de 2:00 a 6:00 p.m., él no ha tenido ningún problema en administrarlo.
Comprará harina, manteca, aceite, levaduras, etc., con esto tendrá la materia prima necesaria para trabajar sin ninguna limitante, espera reforzar el inventario de negocio, aumentar la producción, tener mejores ganancias con las cuales cancelara su deuda y dará mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
Sueña con tener un negocio mucho más rentable y darle a sus hijos una alimentación, salud, vestuario y una educación superior.
texts.en:
José enjoys his family, comprised of his wife and two children, ages four and three.  He earns a living as a baker and works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m. and from 2:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m.  He has not had any problems with management of the business.

He plans to buy flour, shortening, oil, yeast, etc. to have the necessary raw materials on hand to work without limitation.  He hopes to strengthen his inventory, increase production and profits so he can pay off debt and give his famly better living conditions.

His goal is to make his business much more profitable so he can feed and clothe his children and provide them with a healthy environment and higher education.

loans.use: To buy flour, shortening, oil, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Mishaki

texts.en:
Mishaki is 38 years old, married to Suzan, and they live in  Makindye, a city suburb,  with their  four children.

Mishaki started this business of poultry seven years ago as source of income after he had failed to get a formal job, thus he needed to find means for the survival of his family since he is the sole  breadwinner of the entire family.

He has hopes of expanding his business into a medium-sized farm so as to increase on his income so that he can be able to provide for his family adequately. 

Mishaki‘s major challenge is limited funds to grow his poultry business. He is therefore asking for a loan of one million shillings (1,000,000 UGX) to buy more birds.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Silver

texts.en:
Silver is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in Fort Potal region in Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 2 of them currently in school.  For the past 15 years, Silver has been working hard to manage his coffee shop, which sells coffee.  To help expand his business, Silver has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more coffee to sell, and will help Silver to generate greater profits and pay for school fees and his family's basic needs. Silver hopes that in the future he will be able to add capital to the business. 

Silver is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Silver who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 32 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the  region of Mbarara in Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past five years, Allen has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes and materials. 

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her stock and buy more clothes, and will help Allen to generate greater profits and improve her income, which is used for family support and school fees. 

Allen hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a bigger boutique. 

Allen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Allen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase her stock and buy more clothes

loans.name: Magali

texts.es:
Magali vive en alquiler en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Bajo Llojeta  de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de empleada domestica y tambien se dedica a la venta de comestibles; su esposo es albañil. Magali necesita el crédito para la compra de más mercaderia y así poder obtener mayores ingresos y poder cubrir  los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Magali es poder tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Magali rents a brick house with a cement floor in the area of Bajo Llojeta in the city of La Paz.  She works as a domestic employee and also sells groceries.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  

Magali needs a loan to buy more groceries so she can increase her income and cover household expenses.  Her dream is to have her own home one day.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to improve her monthly income.

loans.name: Gulibyo

texts.en:
Gulibyo is 47 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the region of Mbale in Uganda. He is married and has five children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Gulibyo has been working hard to manage his grocery shop where he sells sugar, pads, soap, salt, bread sweets, oil, Vaseline, and eggs. 

To help expand his business, Gulibyo has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, pads, soap, salt, bread, sweets, oil, Vaseline and eggs, and will help Gulibyo to generate greater profits and increase stock to get more income for school fees. Gulibyo hopes that in the future, he will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Gulibyo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gulibyo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, pads, soap, salt, bread, sweets, oil, Vaseline, and eggs

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 50 years old and lives in the town of Tororo, in the region of mbale in Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, 2 of which currently attend school.  For the past 10 years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her local brew business, which sells local brew in various quantities. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase millet and sorghum, and will help Beatrice to generate greater profits which will help her pay for her children's school fees.  Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: La señora Basilia tiene 22 años, vive en Monteagudo, es casada y tiene una hija que depende de ella, vive y en alquiler y trabaja desde ahí, se dedica a la confección de ropa de vestir y deportiva, de esta forma genera ingresos para mantener a su hija, actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima (telas e hilos) y una maquina industrial para confección de prendas, así podrá aumentar su trabajo y tener más ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Basilia, 22, lives in Monteagudo.  She is married and has a daughter in her care.  She rents the home she lives in and works from there making clothing and sportswear.  Working as a seamstress is how she generates an income to support her daughter.  The loan she is requesting is to buy raw materials (fabric and thread) and an industrial sewing machine to make clothing.  This will allow her to increase her work load and income to cover expenses and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy raw materials (fabric and thread) and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 36 years old and is married with two children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Martin grows coffee, maize, beans, vegetables and bananas. He also has cows, goats and sheep.

As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Martin will buy more farm land to diversify his farm activities. His biggest dream in life is to become a model farmer in his district and educate other farmers on improved agricultural practices.

loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale.

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Saum is still single with no children.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

She has operated a cafe business making staples like, rice, tea,  beans, chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours.  She cited seasonality  as a major challenge.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is an industrious lady who is working hard to better her living standards. The previous loan helped her to buy a water tank which is helping her run her business well. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 30,000 to buy more water containers for selling water to earn more income. She appreciates the support form Kiva and Yehu at large.

loans.use: to buy more water containers for selling water to earn more income.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
This is Janet, age 34, who is a resident of Silang, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is married to Filbert, a painter, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Janet operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue to operate her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Janet hopes that her variety store will become a grocery store and dreams that her children will receive a quality education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized in fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy spare parts for her jeepney. Her income from this business is helpful in their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marceline dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes that her grandchildren will have a bright future. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

Note: Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers who helped the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn money and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney – open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 38 years old and married with two children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods such as canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil, bread, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Rosemarie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil, bread, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Celia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Celia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock such as soft drinks, soap, eggs, noodles, sugar, milk, etc. for her general store business.

Celia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as soft drinks, soap, egg, noodles, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Julieta is 50 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Julieta has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Julieta has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Julieta has been in this business for three years. In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Meera

texts.en: Meera is a 46-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly, which has resulted in his inability to generate an income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Meera has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Meera is so very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 39 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Ann is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Mary Ann has been raising pigs for 1 year and also earns additional income from a general store business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa is 55 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of sugar, rice, coffee, etc. to sell. She has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from food vending and pre-paid mobile loads. Celsa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sugar, rice, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Doane

texts.en:
Doane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc. for her general store business. Doane has been in this business for 13 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Doane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben is 44 years old, married, and a farmer who is living at Amulung. He plants and harvests rice to sell. His wife is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). They had a child who still lives with him. From the farming business he manages, he usually earns just enough income to sustain their daily meals and remain in business. His wife’s remittances cover other family bills and expenses. Ruben wanted to improve his crop production; that is why he is asking for additional revolving capital amounting to 15,000 PHP. The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and pesticides. He knows that this loan will help ensure a profitable harvest from his rice field.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Luz Gloria

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer pujante y trabajadora que siempre tiene una actitud positiva frente a la vida. Madre cabeza de hogar, que ha sacado adelante a sus dos hijos con gran esfuerzo y dedicación, pues desde que se separó de su ex esposo no ha recibido apoyo económico para el sostenimiento de sus hijos.
 A sus 52 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, una legumbrería que inició como alternativa para generar recursos económicos para la familia, ubicado en un local comercial cercano a la plaza de mercado del municipio, ventaja que le ha favorecido porque diariamente llegan clientes a comprar las frutas y verduras frescas que ofrece.
El propósito con el crédito es comprar surtido al por mayor de frutas y verduras para seguir ofreciendo a sus cliente variedad, calidad y buen precio, que le permita aumentar su nivel de ventas y los ingresos que percibe; esto la impulsará para que en un futuro cercano pueda cumplir el sueño de ampliar su negocio, pues Luz desea generar mejores ingresos económicos que le permitan dar una buena educación secundaria y universitaria a sus hijos y mejorar el nivel de vida y bienestar del núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Luz, 52, is a determined and hardworking woman who always has a positive attitude toward life.  She's the head of her household and has gotten her two children ahead with a lot of effort and dedication, because she hasn't received any child support since she separated from her ex-husband.

Luz makes a living tending to her produce business, which she started as a way to earn an income for her family.  Her business is located in a shopping area near the town market.  This has been an advantage for her because customers arrive daily to buy the fresh fruits and vegetables she sells.

Her goal with the loan is to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale to keep on offering her customers variety, quality, and good prices, which will allow her to increase her sales and her income.

This will motivate Luz to achieve her dream of expanding her business in the near future.  She wants to earn more income so she can give her children a good secondary and college education and improve the standard of living and well-being of her immediate family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio shares his secrets of being a good barber. He learned his skill from his eldest brothers. When he had enough knowledge on men's and women's hair cuts, he decided to work in someone’s salon. According to him, the salary he obtained from his job as a hair cutter served as his capital for renting his own stall to use as a barber shop. Now, Bonifacio has managed a barber shop in the market for four years. 

He does hair cutting and gives a basic massage after cutting and trimming his customers' hair. Gained profits from his barber shop business have been used to sustain his family's basic needs. Now he aims to earn a higher income than his usual earnings through asking for additional capital of 10,000 Philippine pesos. He will use the loan to buy scissors, shears and powder. In addition, he will pay rent for his stall. 

Bonifacio will do his service well to his customers to encourage more customers, which will enable him to earn a higher income and let him work abroad as an expert barber.

loans.use: to buy scissors, shears and powder for his barber shop business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Analyn works hard to support her family. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store business. Analyn is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is a 50-year-old married man and a father of three. He is a farmer who plants and harvests rice crops to sell. He usually earns 30,000 PHP twice a year, and it goes for meals, bills at home, and education expenses. Renato aspires to improve his crop production. That is why he is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to invest in his farm. He will buy insecticides and pesticides as well as pay laborers who help plant rice seedlings. 

In the future, he hopes to keep reaping abundant harvests for the overall welfare of his family and to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and pesticides as well as pay laborers who help plant rice seedlings on his farmland

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pig fattening business. Cerila has been in this business for 6 years. She earns additional income from a general store business.

Cerila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 48 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Delia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like spices, chips, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Delia has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like spices, chips, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Inocensia

texts.en:
Inocensia is 30 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Inocensia is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Inocensia has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from selling bananas. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, es soltero y no tiene hijos vive en una casa alquilada ocupando una habitación con cocina y baño compartido, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa El Carmen de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día en una empresa privada como técnico,ya que con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación ,transporte, alquiler y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo necesita para el pago de la actualización de un curso de electricidad que le sera de mucha ayuda en su trabajo.
El sueño de Juan es mejorar sus ingresos para adquirir un anticretico y ahorrar en el pago de alquileres de esta forma también mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan is single and doesn't have children. He lives in a rented property, occupying a room and sharing a bathroom and kitchen. The house is in the Villa El Carmen area of the city of La Paz.
He currently works for more than 8 hours a day in a private technical company and he must use his income to cover his food and transportation expenses, his rent, and to pay his utilities.
He needs the loan to pay for a course on electrics that will be of great help in his work. 
Juan's dream is to improve his income buy getting a special sort of rental agreement that would enable him to save and improve his quality of life. 
This is his second time working with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for an up to date electrical course that will help him greatly in his work.

loans.name: Wendwaoga 2 Mogtedo 1 Group

texts.fr:
Mme CLAIRE représente le groupe WENDWAOGA 1 MOGTEDO. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 35ans et le moins âgé a 19ans 03 vont à l’école (université)  et a 13 personnes en charge.
Mme est étuveuse de riz depuis 30ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Mogtedo. Ses clients sont  les femmes de Pouytenga.
Elle veut s’acheter 01tone de riz.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut investir dans les études de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne acheter des vivres pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claire is the featured borrower of Wendwaoga 1 Mogtedo Group. She's married and the mother of six children. The eldest is 35 years old, the youngest is 19. Three of them go to school (university). She has 13 people in her care.

For thirty years, Mrs. Claire has been parboiling rice. She gets her supplies in Mogtedo. Her customers are women from Pouytenga.

She wants to buy 1 ton of rice. She wants to use her profits to invest in her children's education. She also ambitions to buy food for her family.

loans.use: to buy 1 ton of rice

loans.name: Wendwaoga 2 Mogtedo 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM représente le groupe WENDWAOGA 2 MOGTEDO 2. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 10ans.  03 vont à l’école et a 12 personnes en charge.
Mme est étuveuse de riz depuis 15ans. Elle s’approvisionne à  Mogtedo. Ses clients sont  les femmes de Pouytenga.
Elle veut s’acheter 01tone de riz.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut investir dans les études de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne acheter une parcelle pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam is the featured borrower of Wendwaoga 2 Mogtedo Group. She's married and the mother of four children. The eldest is 15 years old, the youngest is 10. Three of them go to school. She has 12 people in her care.

For fifteen years, Mrs. Mariam has been parboiling rice. She gets her supplies in Mogtedo. Her customers are women from Pouytenga.

She wants to buy 1 ton of rice. She wants to use her profits to invest in her children's education. She also ambitions to buy a land lot for her family.

loans.use: to buy 1 ton of rice

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora María  se dedica a la  elaboración de tortillas desde hace  16 años como también a la elaboración de veladoras las cuales se realizaran en su domicilio, ella necesita otro crédito para   la compra de maíz  leña ,parafina, porta mechas, para las fiestas  navideñas y así  variar sus ventas  de veladoras aromáticas y decorativas, y poder seguir atendiendo a nuevos clientes en la venta de tortillas, ella desea seguir creciendo en sus negocios  y en el futuro poder comprar parafina aromática por mayor para mejorar mas sus ventas.
texts.en: María has been working making tortillas for 16 years and also making candles at home. She needs another loan to buy corn, wood, paraffin, wicks, for the Christmas festivities to vary her sales of scented and decorative candles and to be able to serve new clients for her tortillas. She wants to keep growing her businesses and, in the future, to be able to buy scented paraffin in bulk to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy materials for making scented candals and to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is aged 46 and married, but does not have children. She and her husband live in a rural community with Thelma's beloved parents. She has owned and managed a small variety store for more than ten years now. Having no other source of income, she aims for further improvement in order to increase her income and support her parents' needs. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 47,000 PHP to buy more stocks of snack food, assorted candies, canned goods, noodles, laundry soap, beverages, seasoning, frozen foods, rice and soft drinks to sell. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted in order to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack food, assorted candies, canned goods, noodles, laundry soap, beverages, seasoning, frozen foods, rice and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Dúo Luz Y Verdad Group

texts.es:
DUO LUZ Y VERDAD
Doña Mercedes, ella es originaria de la aldea xetzac, del  municipio de Tecpán, bajo su responsabilidad están sus 5 hijas, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales(vacas) y a la fabricación de quesos.
Ella a empezo su negocio desde hace algunos años atrás, gracias a dios a podido salir adelante, ahora ya tiene más animales para crianza.
Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijas ella sigue trabajando, ahora con la venta de sus quesos ya tiene cinco restaurantes donde ella entrega sus quesos.
El sueños de ella es ampliar mas su negocio tener otros animales para la crianza, y tener más capital para poder elaborar sus quesos, ya que así ella tendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijas a estudiar a la escuela.
texts.en:
The Light and Truth Duo
Mercedes is originally from the village Xetzac in the municipality of Tecpán. She has 5 daughters under her care. She works breeding animals (cows) and making cheese.
She started her business some years ago. Thanks to God, she has been successful. Now she needs more animals to breed. 
Thanks to support from her husband and her daughters, she continues working. She now has 5 restaurants to which she delivers cheese. 
Her dreams are to grow her business more, to have more animals to breed, and to have more capital for making her cheeses as this would give her better profits and enable her to send her daughters to school.

loans.use: to buy animals to breed and to sell cheese.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia, es soltera y no tiene hijos vive en casa de sus familiares ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleada vendiendo frutas por mas de diez horas al día.
El credito lo necesita para invertirlo como capital de arranque para comprar frutas y tener su porpio puesto de ventas y aumentar sus ingresos ya que con lo poco que gana debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos,de esta forma desea trabajar de forma independiente.
El sueño de Amalia, es tener su puesto de venta propio en el tambo para tener estabilidad laboral y mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y también con KIVA.
texts.en:
Amalia is single and does not have children. She lives in her family's house, occupying only an adobe bedroom with an earth floor. The house is in the Pampahasi area of the city of La Paz.
She currently works as an employee selling fruits for more than 10 hours a day.
She needs the loan to invest as startup capital to buy fruits and have her own stall to sell them and increase her income as the little that she earns must be used to cover her food expenses and utilities. She wants to work for herself.
Amalia's dream is to have her own stall so she can have steady work and improve her quality of life. 
This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: startup capital to buy fruits and sell them independently.

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es:
José, necesita invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar, levadura y otros ingredientes necesarios para elaborar el pan que luego ofrece a sus clientes, de esta manera darán un mejor servicio y fortalecerá su negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior José, aumento sus ventas mejoro su economía, cuanta con clientes más satisfechos, cancelo sus deudas y su familia hoy tiene un estilo de vida mucho mejor y se encuentra muy saludables.
texts.en:
José needs to invest in flour, butter, sugar, yeast and other ingredients necessary for making the bread that he later sells to his customers. In this way, he will give them better service and strengthen his business. 
José used his previous loan to increase his sales and improve his finances, make his customers more satisfied, and cancel his debts. Now his family has a much improved quality of life and are very healthy.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, sugar, yeast, and other items.

loans.name: Wendwaoga 3 Mogtedo 3 Group

texts.fr:
Mme SALAMATA  représente le groupe WENDWAOGA 3 MOGTEDO 3. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 25ans.  02 vont à l’école (ses petits enfants) et a 15 personnes en charge.
Mme est étuveuse de riz depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne à  Mogtedo. Ses clients sont  les femmes de Pouytenga et Zorgho.
Elle veut s’acheter 01tone de riz.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut scolariser  ses petits enfants. Mme ambitionne acheter une moto pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Salamata is the representative for the Wendwaoga 3 Mogtedo 3 Group.  She is married and has two children, who are 25 years old and 30 years old.  Two of her grandchildren attend school and she is responsible for a total of fifteen people.

Salamata has worked par-boiling rice for ten years.  She buys her supplies in Mogtedo and sells her rice to the women of Pouytenga and Zorgho.

Salamata will buy one tonne of rice with her loan.  With her earnings, she will pay for the schooling of her grandchildren.  

In the future, she would like to buy a motorbike for her family.

loans.use: to buy 1 tonne of rice for resale.

loans.name: Wendwaoga 4 Mogtedo 4 Group

texts.fr:
Mme SALAMATA  représente le groupe WENDWAOGA 4 MOGTEDO 4. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 18ans.  04 vont à l’école  et a 18 personnes en charge.
Mme est étuveuse de riz depuis 30ans. Elle s’approvisionne à  Mogtedo. Ses clients sont  les femmes de Pouytenga  et  Ouaga.
Elle veut s’acheter 01tone de riz.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut scolariser  ses enfants. Mme ambitionne acheter une moto pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Salamata is the representative for the Wendwaoga 4 Mogtedo 4 Group.  She is married and has five children.  The eldest is twenty years old and the youngest is eighteen years old.  Four of her children attend school and she is responsible for a total of eighteen people.

Salamata has worked par-boiling rice for thirty years.  She buys her supplies in Mogtedo and sells her rice to the women of Pouytenga and Ouaga.

Salamata will buy one tonne of rice with her loan, and she will use her earnings to pay for the schooling of her children.

In the future, Salamata would like to buy a motorbike for her family.

loans.use: to buy 1 tonne of rice for resale.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
LUIS se dedica a la producción de panes y masitas,  junto a sus padres con quienes vive pues él es un joven soltero que desea independizarse ya que el horno en el que trabaja es compartido con su padre, su producción la vende a los intermediarios los cuales se encargan de hacer llegar al publico consumidor, en la población de Achacachi, considerada ya una ciudad intermedia.

El crédito  requiere para comprar harina al por mayor y así minimizar gastos e incrementar su producción de panes y masitas y por ende mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia.

El sueño de Luis es incrementar su  producción y algún día tener su propio negocio independiente.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Luis earns a living making bread and pastry.  He works with his parents, with whom he lives.  He's a single young man who wants to go out on his own, because he shares his oven with his father.  Luis sells his products to intermediaries who get it to the public consumer in the town of Achacachi, considered a medium-sized city.

Luis needs the loan to buy flour wholesale and minimize his expenses to increase his pastry and bread production.  Consequently he'll improve his and his family's income.

Luis's dream is to increase his production and have his own independent business one day.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale

loans.name: Momokiz

texts.ru: Момокиз родилась в 1965 году. Она трудолюбивая и добросовестна женщина. Момокиз уже более 10 лет занимается купле продажей молочных продуктов. Она покупает молоко из местных жителей, обрабатывает и продает в центральном рынке области. Последние месяцы были очень сложные. У нее украли сумку с деньгами. Для восстановления своего бизнеса она продала свою дойную корову. Момокиз является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и не отправляет достаточно денег. Деньги, которые отправляет ее муж, она использует для обучения своих двоих детей, которые учатся в Медицинском университете. Момокиз обратилась за займом в сумме 2500 сомони для покупки зимней одежды для своих детей. Она имеет 3 детей. Момокиз ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Momokiz is a hardworking and conscientious woman who was born in 1965. She has been buying and selling dairy products for more than 10 years, purchasing milk from local residents, processing it and selling it in the central market. The past few months have been very difficult - her purse was stolen, with money in it, and to keep her business going she sold her own milking cow. Momokiz is the primary breadwinner in the family, as her husband is a working migrant in Russia and doesn't send back enough money. The amount that he does send, she uses for her children's education costs at the medical university. Momokiz is requesting a loan of 2,500 somoni to purchase winter clothing for her three children. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes for her children

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en: Rosina is applying for a loan of 1000 USD to improve her business. She is running a business in her house by selling slippers, noodles, fish, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee and water. She makes a good income from selling these items. And she wants to buy more stock for her store with this loan. She lives in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she sells every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her working capital of 600 USD.

loans.use: to buy slippers, noodles, fish, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee and water.

loans.name: Genesia

texts.en:
Genesia is applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin (TRM). She is married and has three children. She is 38 years old. 

Genesia is running a mini shop in front of her house and she will use this loan to buy trousers, shorts, shirts, long sleeve and short sleeve T-shirts as well as church clothes. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loans in the future. She is happy with her loan because TRM offers loans to poor people to improve their living conditions for the future.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shorts, shirts, long sleeve and short sleeve T-shirts as well as church clothes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives at Amulung with his spouse and two children. He has a farming business. He particularly plants and harvests rice to sell. His wife cooks snacks for laborers who plant and harvest the rice crop. Joseph wants to improve his crop production; that is why he is borrowing a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and insecticides used in farming. Joseph believes that this loan amount will allow him to obtain a good harvest of his crop. 

Someday, Joseph would like to keep improving his farming practices so he can give his family am improved life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for farming.

loans.name: Marigrace

texts.en:
Marigrace previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marigrace hopes to improve the status of her business and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is the age of 53. She is living with her husband happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small general store in a nearby town to support his family. He is a very energetic and honest person. He opens his shop early in the morning and closes it late at night. His beloved customers suggested for him to offer bakery items also, because there is not any nearby bakery. He is very famous in his street due to his honesty. He wants to offer bakery items as well but he does not have cash in hand to buy bakery items to sell. 

Therefore, Shehnaz requested a loan for her husband from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy fresh and healthy bakery items such as bream, jam, butter and cookies.

Shehnaz says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy additional bakery items for a general store.

loans.name: Nadra

texts.en: Nadra is a 35-year-old married woman. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. She is a very hardworking and responsible housewife.  Her husband has been in the business of selling milk, which is the only source of income for the family. Currently, he is interested in purchasing one buffalo to grow his business but finds it difficult due to financial constraints. Nadra has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his milk selling business but will increase his net income and savings as well. Nadra hopes to provide quality education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband purchase one buffalo to grow his business.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio se dedica a la producción de quesos,  junto a su esposa; tiene  dos hijos los cuales viven en la ciudad de La Paz pues ya son casados. Los quesos que Gregorio y su esposa elaboran los vende directamente al publico en días de feria en la población de Achacachi, considerada ya una ciudad intermedia en plena area rural.
Actualmente vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Pajchani  del municipio de Achacachi a dos   horas y media de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche, con la que elabora su producción.

El crédito  requiere para comprar una vaca lechera y así incrementar su producción de leche para mejorar su porducción de quesos.

El sueño de Gregorio es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Gregorio makes a living making cheeses.  He is married and has two children, both of whom live in the city of La Paz as they are now married.  Gregorio and his wife sell their cheeses directly to the public in Achacachi on market day.  Achacachi is a hub city in the middle of a rural area.

Gregorio owns the house where he lives, and it is in the Pajchani community of the Achacachi municipality, some two and a half hours from La Paz.  Gregorio also has some cattle which provide him with milk in order to make cheese.

Gregorio needs this loan in order to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and thereby increase production of cheese, his final product.

Gregorio's dream is to increase his number of cattle.

This is the first time that Gregorio has applied to IMPRO and Kiva for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and thereby increase production of cheese, his final product.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 26 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, es un joven  muy trabajador y responsable desde hace varios años se dedica a la pesca artesanal, contando con una pequeña lancha y algunas redes para obtener mariscos. Esa es su única fuente de trabajo la cual ahora le permite salir adelante. El cliente solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más redes para pescar, anzuelos y otros instrumentos necesarios para su trabajo. El cliente desea darles una mejor vida a su familia en donde puedan contar con todo lo necesario.
texts.en: This borrower is 26 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children.  He is very hard-working and responsible and, for a number of years now, the borrower has been working as a fisherman.  He has a small boat and some nets in order to catch shellfish.  This is the borrower's only job and it is allowing him to get ahead in life.  This borrower is applying for a loan from Apoyo Integral and, with it, he will have the money that he needs to invest in buying more fishing nets, hooks and other tools for his work.  This borrower wants to give his family a better life and for them to have everything that they need.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets, hooks and other tools.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items needed in her variety store. Her income from business is assisting her everyday household expenditures. She also has a farm, which is being managed by her husband.

She would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Esmeralda dreams that her business will last long and hopes to have a good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zikrillo

texts.ru: Этому мужчине 36 лет. Его зовут Зикрилло. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка, она занимается домашними роботами. Трое его детей учатся в школе. Он в своей жизни пробовал многое и имеет большой опыт работы в сфере торговли. Сначала Зикрилло начал свою деятельность в сфере животноводства. Покупал скота из одного рынка и перепродавал на другом скотном рынке с наценкой. После он начал заниматься продажей картошки и лука.  Закупал товар оптом от земледельцев и продавал с наценкой на маленьком рынке рядом с его домом. Таким образом,  он накопил денег. На сумму сбережения он приобрел молочную будку для продажи молочных продуктов. Зикрилло твердо решил начать новый бизнес по продаже молочных продуктов. У него есть около $600, но для приобретения начального товара денег не хватает. По этой причине он просит кредит. Он уже нашел молочный комбинат, где будет покупать продукты и осталось ему помочь, чтобы он начал свой бизнес. Помогите ему!
texts.en: This man called Zikrillo is 36. He is married with three children. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of household chores. Their three children are in school. Zikrillo has tried many things in his life and has a great deal of experience in retail and trade. At first he started working in animal husbandry - he bought cattle from one market and resold them with markup at another cattle market. After that he started selling potatoes and onions. He bought goods at wholesale prices from the growers and sold them with markup at a small market near his home. In such a way, he was able to save money, which he put toward the acquisition of a milk stall to sell dairy products. Zikrillo has made the decision to start a new business selling dairy products. He has about $600, but it is not enough to acquire the inventory he needs to begin. For this reason he is asking for a loan. He has already found a milk processor where he will buy his goods and he just needs help to start his business. Please help him!

loans.use: to start a business selling dairy products

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo repairs farm machines in his stall. To give his family better way of life, he also earns extra income by selling surplus tools to replace the damaged parts of farm machines. Some of his customers suggest that he sell some parts of machines that are seldom sold in other shops. Therefore, Danilo is asking for a loan of 50,000  PHP to buy chain rollers, bearings, belts, bushing and sprockets. Danilo hopes to satisfy his customers with this service and be known to others who are not yet his customers.

loans.use: to buy chain rollers, bearings, belts, bushing and sprockets for his vehicle repairs business

loans.name: Heroína

texts.es:
Heroína es madre soltera de un hijo de 3 años de edad, al que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación. Nació en el seno de una familia humilde campesina que encontró en las labores agrícolas una alternativa de vida y fue allí donde aprendió todo lo que hoy sabe en el manejo de cultivos y cría de animales.
A sus 40 años de edad, posee un cultivo de café y además cría y comercializa pollos, trabaja sola todos los días desde las primeras horas de la mañana y la producción de café y de pollos es vendida en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside, así logra generar los ingresos que le permitan dar el sustento a su pequeño hijo y solventar los gastos básicos del hogar.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su oficio, solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará insumos agrícolas (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes) y 30 crías de pollos más, así logrará aumentar la producción y podrá vender más, dando como resultado un incremento en los ingresos.
Heroína sueña con ampliar su negocio con más cultivos y ampliando su galpón, para mejorar los ingresos por ventas y garantizar una estabilidad económica que le permita dar a su hijo una educación de calidad y mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar, con la ampliación de su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Heroína, 40, is the single mother of a 3-year-old child whom she has gotten ahead with a lot of effort and dedication.  She was born into a humble farming family that found a way of life in agricultural labor, where she learned everything she knows today about growing crops and raising animals.

Heroína has a coffee crop and also sells chickens.  She works alone every day, starting very early in the morning.  She sells her harvest and her chickens in the market plaza of the town where she lives, earning an income to support her young child and pay for the household expenses.

Heroína wants to strengthen her business, so she's requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs (soil amendments, pesticide, and fertilizer) and 30 additional chicks.  This way she'll be able to increase production and sell more, raising her income as a result.

Heroína dreams of expanding her business with more crops and a larger chicken coop so she can improve her sales and income and ensure economic stability.  As a result she can give her son a quality education and better living conditions and well-being by expanding her modest home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and 30 chicks

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
A 600 USD loan is offered to Romana to improve her business. Romana opened her business in 2012 with her own effort. She will use this loan to buy gasoline. Romana is generating a good income from selling this product. 

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Romana lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya, 34, is the mother of three children. Her husband owns a stationery shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family.

The current stock of his shop is almost finished, so he needs to purchase a variety of stationery products for the shop. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to do so. This loan will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

Therefore, his wife Aliya is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase a variety of products to resell. Aliya is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of stationery products to resell.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad is 31 years old, a married man with children, and they live in Sana`a. To make a living, he owns & operates a car accessories shop. He has been in this business for over 3 years. He started his business with limited capital. He gained access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to improve his business activities. He is very friendly and has already gained some permanent customers. He helps himself by bringing in new goods from the market where he buys supplies for his business. 

Due to the current unstable situation in Yemen, however, his business has had lower profits and fewer customers. So, he requested a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy additional car accessories and supplies for his business. That should increase his sales, since this type of product is very popular. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy additional car accessories and supplies for his business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling herbal medicines in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of herbal medicine to sell for her herbal medicine business.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years. 

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 59 years old and married, with four children. 

Segundina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Segundina has been in pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Segundina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is married, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lilibeth is 45 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Lilibeth has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her livestock.

Lilibeth has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, se ha decidido por otro crédito por que necesita capital para pagar transporte y mano de obra para recolectar su cosecha de granos básicos, de esta forma podrá tener su producción resguardada en su casa.
Con la inversión anterior aumento su producción tanto en el cultivo de granos básicos como en la granja de pollos que posee, sus ventas son mayores, su economía ha mejorado mucho, también ofrece  a su familia una mejor educación, alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
Concepción has decided to take out another loan as he needs capital to pay for transport and labourers to bring in the harvest of basic grains.  Once the harvest is collected, he can store it in his home.

With his previous loan, Concepción was able to increase production, both of basic grains and of chickens.  His sales are higher and his financial situation has greatly improved.  He is providing his family with a better education, better food, and better health.

loans.use: to pay for transport and labourers to bring in the harvest.

loans.name: Geraldo

texts.en:
Geraldo is the sole owner and founder of Allen Consultants, a company operating in Silver Spring, Maryland since 2004.  The company’s core business is to prepare corporate and individual tax returns.  The company’s secondary services are to prepare small business’ financial statements, assist with 8-a certification and help businesses with the incorporation process.  
 
The reason Geraldo is in need of financing is because of the seasonality of his business. As Geraldo explained, his peak season follows the tax season (January 15th – October 15th). The months of November and December are the slowest and it’s during this time that Geraldo’s company generates income from its secondary services, which are less profitable. Last fall, Geraldo went to the “loan sharks” for a 33 percent interest rate loan to help him get over this “hump.” He vowed to not go down that path again this fall. He turned to LEDC to help him during this lull in business before the tax season ramps back up in January 2014.  
 
Geraldo is originally from Queens, New York.  He is a trained engineer who spent many years building model trains before obtaining his MBA from the University of Maryland and entering into the accounting field in the mid-1990’s.  He has two grown children who live in Missouri and North Carolina. In the future, Geraldo would like to expand his services to business clients, such as help his clients obtain small business loans, win contracts, and certify more minority firms at the state and federal level.

loans.use: to cover operating expenses during the slow season

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is originally from Ecuador and came to the United States 12 years ago. In Ecuador, she started a party supply store specializing in handmade piñatas called “Pinateria Mil Colores.” The company is still in operation and her three daughters run the company. While living in Ecuador, Blanca learned the hair stylist trade and began cutting hair as a hobby for additional income. 

When she arrived in the States, Blanca dedicated herself full-time to the hair salon profession. She has 12 years of experience in the industry and six of those years as the sole owner and founder of Columbia Hair Salon in the Adams Morgan neighborhood of Washington, D.C; a few blocks away from the LEDC headquarters.  Blanca is requesting a $10,000 loan to renovate her salon. She would like to construct six new salon stations for her stylists. At the moment, the salon employs five stylists full-time. Blanca hopes that in the future she can employ additional stylists.

loans.use: to renovate her hair salon in Washington, D.C.

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.en:
With his prior experience working at a gas station, Eulalio created a solution to meet an important yet unfulfilled customer need. He began his own business delivering gas to commercial development companies, including large boats and businesses in the construction industry. 

Started in March 2013, L.A.B. Gas Transportation now operates all over New Jersey. Based in Perth Amboy, the business is the only one of its kind in the area. 

L.A.B.'s primary customers are acquired through word of mouth. In just nine months, Eulalio's clientele has grown from one to four large businesses. Eulalio considers himself very blessed for the growth of his small company, which employs a handful of his family members as well.

Eulalio hopes to open a two-pump gas station and eventually, he would like to franchise out L.A.B. throughout New Jersey. For now, Eulalio is looking to purchase two more 150-gallon tankers with pumps to transport gas to clients at various construction and boating sites. The loan will go toward the purchase of these items.

loans.use: To purchase two tankers for gas transportation start-up

loans.name: Ricaurte

texts.en:
Ricaurte is a native of Colombia. He is married and has one child. Ricaurte has more than 12 years of experience as a beauty supply store manager. A couple of years ago, Ricaurte started planning to have his own business. He started working with LEDC Small Business Department receiving technical assistant to create a business plan, implement his accounting systems, and obtain his licenses. 

Finally this year, he found a good location to start his business in Beltsville, MD. With a LEDC loan of $4,000 he is going to develop his business web page to increase its sales  He is expecting this  additional income to support his family  and send his child to college.

loans.use: to develop his business web page

loans.name: Zhonginoy

texts.ru:
Жонгиной 47 лет. Она начинающая бизнес woman. Жонгиной планирует начать бизнес по животноводству. Она будет покупать маленьких скотов из местного рынка. И будет их кормить и содержать в своем коровнике. После 30 и более дней откорма. Жонгиной продаст скотов с наценкой на местном рынке. 
  На сегодняшний день Жонгиной имеет двух дойных коров для семейных нужд и 10 разноцветных птиц. Для Жонгиной это первый бизнес и она к этой деятельности относится очень серьезно. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить несколько голов мелких скотов. Причина, по которой она берет кредит недостаточная сумма  начального капитала. Жонгиной очень надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Zhonginoy is 47 and a new businesswoman. She plans to start a business in animal husbandry. She will buy young cattle from the local market, feed them and keep them in her cow shed. After a month or more of fattening, she will sell the cattle with mark-up at the market. 

Zhonginoy currently has two milk cows for her family's needs and 10 multicoloured birds. This will be her first business and she is approaching it very seriously. She is asking for a loan to buy a few head of small cattle, since she doesn't have enough starting capital. She hopes very much for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy young cattle and start a business in animal husbandry

loans.name: Dúo Efecios Group

texts.es: Dúo Efecios La señora Ruth Maribel se dedica a la venta de mercería, venta de cremas, peines, papel higiénico, pañales desechables, jabón de baño, de ropa, jabón para trastos y más, se a dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años.  Las ventas han aumentado porque las fiestas de fin de año se aproximan.  Pero se ve en  la necesidad de solicitar un crédito más, ya que necesita comprar varias cosas en la venta por fardos, que son cajas grandes que traen el producto por más de 10 docenas de pañales, y que al comprarlo  salen baratos y se obtiene más ganancia.  Esta muy agradecida con Dios por la oportunidad de recibir una ayuda desde muy lejos kiva y con las personas por brindarles su confianza.des lesea muchas bendiciones y que Dios los bendiga.
texts.en:
Efecios Duo

Ruth Maribel has made a living for three months selling notions, lotion, combs, toilet paper, disposable diapers, bath soap, detergent, soap, and other things.  Sales have increased because the holiday season is approaching.

She needs to request another loan, however, because she needs various things sold by the bundle, such as large boxes of more than 10 dozen diapers.  They're cheaper to buy this way and she earns more profit.

Ruth Maribel's grateful to God for the opportunity of receiving some help from afar and to Kiva and the people who trust her.  She wishes them God's blessings.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, diapers, and lotion

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
Non is 34 years old and she was educated to primary school level. She is married and has five children, four of whom are attending school. Non and her husband are raising their children by farming rice and fishing in Siem Reap province. She sells her fish on the bank of the Tonle Sap River after fishing. She has been doing these businesses since 2000.

Non is requesting a loan of USD 500 through HKL to buy a fishing boat as her old boat was ruined. The loan will allow her continue working with her business and make a consistent income for the family. Her dream is to improve her family-owned business and increase the income to satisfy their living needs.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat because her old boat was ruined.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena, aged 30, has owned and operated a retail store for eleven years. With this business she’s able to generate income to provide for her family. She wants to add to her grocery items she offers in her store, and that’s why she is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy noodles, canned goods, bread, vinegar and cooking oil. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted so that she can able to improve her business to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, bread, vinegar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Reynalyn

texts.en:
Reynalyn and her spouse are farmers. She is 29 years old and has two children.

According to her, involvement in the farming business requires working hard and perseverance to become successful farmers. From this, additional capital is needed to improve the growth of her crops. 

With regards to this matter, she is now asking financial assistance of ASKI amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and insecticides) and pay laborers who will perform planting and harvesting rice to sell. 

Someday, she hopes to keep achieving a productive farming business so she can improve her living condition and financial status.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides and pay laborers in planting and harvesting rice to sell

loans.name: Rene Donato

texts.es: El señor Rene tiene 47 años, casada con 2 hijos que tienen la edad de 2 años y un bebe  8 meses, él trabaja como conductor de taxi transportando pasajeros en la localidad de Sacaba, este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, el señor Rene va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que esta solo con pozo y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua así que hará una conexión para baños, ducha y cocina  y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la zona no cuenta con servicios básicos pero esto no impedirá que el señor Rene tenga agua potable en su domicilio. Se siente muy feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Rene is 47 years old. He is married and has two children, ages 2 years and 8 months old. He works as a taxi driver transporting passengers in Sacaba. This loan which is Rene's first with this institution will be used to finished the installation of water in his house. Right now they only have a well and it is a lot of work hauling the water. So he will connect his bathroom, shower and kitchen and provide more comfort for his family. For a variety of reasons the area does not have basic services but this does not stop Rene from having running water in his house. He is very grateful for this opportunity to improve the quality of living of his family.

loans.use: to complete the installation of a water system.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es: Don adan de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, frijol y maicillo con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Adan quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo unos cuartos para sus hijos y poner la instalación eléctrica, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito y poder comprar los materiales necesarios como: cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillos, alambre, cables y pago de mano de obra para que él y su familia puedan vivir cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Adan is 59 years old and lives in his own house with his partner and their two children.  Adan works in agriculture, his main crops being corn, beans and sorghum.  His earnings from his work allow him to cover some household costs. Adan wants to make improvements to his home by building separate bedrooms for his children and by hooking the house up to the electrical grid.  Adan does not, however, earn enough to do this work and so his applying for a loan in order to buy the materials he needs.  Adan needs to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, wire, cables, and to pay labourers in order for him and his family to live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, wire, cables, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a single dad of a fourteen-year-old son. During the recession he lost his job as a maintenance supervisor, but was determined to get back on his feet. He took a job as a roadside service mechanic, allowing him to save enough money to purchase his own tools and flatbed tow truck. It took Juan a few months to gain the experience to start his own roadside service business. 

In mid-2013 Juan started having maintenance issues with the truck, which later broke down. Although the truck was his only source of income, Juan did everything to make sure his truck payments were made on time, by cutting back on personal expenses and downsizing from a house to an apartment. 

Juan has approached several banks but has not been able to find financing. The $5,000 loan will help him pay for the repairs on the truck and other operating expenses. With the help from Fresno CDFI and KIVA he will be able to continue to service the five contracts that he has gained this past year and continue to provide for his family. Fresno CDFI supports the loan request due to Juan’s hard work and good business ethic.

loans.use: to make repairs on his roadside service truck

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 47 years old, married, and has three children. 

Fely is in the agricultural business doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Fely requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fely has been pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Fely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Eufemia is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eufemia has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Laurencia

texts.en:
Laurencia works hard to support her family. Laurencia is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Laurencia requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase another water buffalo for her business. She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Laurencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase another water buffalo for her business

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories in order to maintain his Jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to maintain the Jeepney, and also to buy some equipment for his repair shop. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Virgilio dreams of having additional Jeepney units and hopes to have a bright future. He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work. That is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his Jeepney (public transport vehicle).

loans.name: Manelyn

texts.en:
Manelyn is 29 years old and blessed with three children. They live in a rural community and earn their living through farming. They also engage in raising fingerlings (juvenile fish) to earn additional income. 

They planned to acquire more fingerlings to raise, but they have limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fish feed and additional fingerlings to raise. Through patience and hard work, they believe that they will improve their status of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish feed and additional fingerlings to raise

loans.name: Jermelyn

texts.en:
Jermelyn previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase supplies like oil, sanitizers, alcohol, and other products needed in her massage therapy business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy supplies like oil, sanitizers, alcohol, and other products needed in her massage therapy business.  Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
