She has a small garden where she grows taros, bananas and yams so that she can sell them in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Leiua needs a loan to buy fertilizers, chemicals, barbed wire, a backpack sprayer, bush knives and taro root crops. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Leiua will use the profits from her sales to support her family and also her kids' schooling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, chemicals, barbed wire, a backpack sprayer, bush knives and taro root crops.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 34 años de edad reside junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 8 años y 2 meses de edad.  Pedro se dedica a la comercialización de dulces al menudeo desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de ampliar su negocio de dulces y así poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de dulces al por mayor y así aumentar sus ventas e ingresos y por consecuencia su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 34 years old, and lives with his wife and their two children who are 8 years old and 2 months old.  Pedro has worked in retail selling candy for a very long time.  This is how he earns a living for his family.  

With the goal of increasing his earnings, he has made the decision to expand his candy business in order to improve his family's living conditions.  For this reason, he is seeking this loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing a variety of candy in bulk, which will allow him to increase his sales and earning, and in so doing, improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of candy in bulk.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is 43 years old. She is a widow and lives with her daughter who is 16 years old. Her daughter entered university this year.

Saida opened her small grocery store business on the plot of land where they live. She had been running her business successfully for 16 years. A few months ago, she got sick and had to stay in hospital to get treatment. Because of this, her business was weakened. She is now well and requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase inventory to restart her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rosa Danelia

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida junto con sus hijos y un nieto. Hace muchos años que pudo conseguir un local en el mercado donde vende comidas típicas como baleadas, pastelitos, tacos, tortilla con quesillo, almuerzos, churros, refrescos y otros. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras, para surtir de frutas como uva, manzanas, insumos para elaborar las comidas como arroz, frijoles, carnes, manteca y refrescos. Su objetivo es aprovechar la buena temporada y obtener ingresos para mejorar su casa y el local del negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old. She is a single mother with three children and lives in the municipality of Arizona, Atlántida with her children and grandson. For many years now she has run a stall in the market where she sells local food such as baleadas (wheat flour tortillas), pastries, tacos, tortillas with cheese, lunches, doughnuts, soft drinks etc. 

Rosa is seeking a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy ingredients such as fruit (grapes, apples), rice, beans, meat, butter and drinks for the food she makes. Her goal is to make the most of this lovely time of year to earn more money so she can make improvements to her house and business.

loans.use: Buy fruit such as grapes and apples, rice, beans, meat, butter and soft drinks

loans.name: Dul

texts.en:
Dul is an experienced farmer from the village of Santuk district in Kampong Thom province. He is 34 of age and married with one child who is attending local school. To make a living, Dul plants and harvests rice, which he keeps in a barn for the whole year food and also sells in the local markets for money. He has been engaged in this occupation for nearly 15 years and earns approximately $4.54 per day.

Dul would like to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation. He will use the loan to build a safe latrine at home, so everyone in his family can use it comfortably. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special rate. It has encouraged Dul to focus on ensuring healthful living conditions to safeguard the health of his family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine at home, so everyone in his family can use it comfortably.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar, who has run a sewing business since 2000, lives with her husband and five children. Her husband works in Russia, where his salary is low, as do her two sons. 

Since last year, Dilbar has been rebuilding her house and there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. The loan of 7000 somoni that she has requested will be dedicated to buying some building materials needed in this project.

loans.use: To buy materials for rebuilding her house

loans.name: Aminjon

texts.en:
Aminjon is a very clever boy. He graduated school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils of his school. He likes math, computers, geography, and other subjects. His hobby is playing football. His classmates like him very much. 

This year he has entered to the National University of Tajikistan, the faculty of law. His parents are workers. Their income is too small to pay for Aminjon’s study at the university. Aminjon wants to be one of the best lawyers in his town. He is purposeful and hardworking. He is asking for a loan of $2,000 to pay for study at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Mariatu from Magburaka, Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with five children. In 2010, Mariatu established her business selling used clothing. She started her business because she wanted to contribute toward taking care of her children. Mariatu works from eight in the morning through five thirty six days a week. Her major business challenge is price inflation and the location of her business. 

Mariatu is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothing to sell. She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to increase her living standard and improve her business. In the future, Mariatu plans to import clothing. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Zuma

texts.en:
Zuma is a married man who is very hardworking and responsible. He lives at his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past four years, he has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are town dwellers. He cites high cost of maintenance as being his major challenge. 

With the Kshs 18,000 he wants to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Mohamed from Masuba, Northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married and has four children. He was a commercial driver, but he started his business because he thinks he can raise more money from an assorted drinks business.  

Mohamed runs an assorted drinks business. He sells soft drinks, alcohol and cigarettes. He has been running this business since 1999. He works at the business 12 hours per day and six days per week. Mohamed says that his main challenges are the high cost of licenses and taxation.

Mohamed has requested a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, alcohol and cigarettes for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow him to become a successful businessman and improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Mohamed plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, alcohol and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old James from Masuba, Makeni northern area in Sierra Leone. He was a contractor but it is very difficult to earn a contract.   

James runs a building material store within a busy market area. He sells cement, zinc, nails, door locks, etc. He has been running this business for 15 years. He works at the business from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m., six days per week.  James says that the main challenges to his business are that transporting his goods is very difficult and there is high competition in the market.

James has requested a loan in order to purchase cement, zinc, nails, door locks, etc. for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow him to open a savings account and take care of his family's welfare. In the future, he plans to become a wholesaler. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc, nails, door locks, etc.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 32 years old and married with three children between the ages of 4 and 10 years. He runs a cosmetic business in Masuba in the northern area in Sierra Leone.

He has been in this business since 2001 and sells a variety of cosmetics within a busy market area.  He says that the main challenges to his business are transportation problems and storage facilities.

Anthony requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cream, body shampoo, and hair relaxer for resale. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him increase his business and build a house. In the future, Anthony would like to expand his business more than ever.

loans.use: to purchase more cream, body shampoo, and hair relaxer for resale

loans.name: Mahfooz

texts.en:
Mahfooz is 33 years old, married and the father of five children, most of whom are in primary school. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a food distributor selling fruits and vegetables using his rickshaw. He is very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic, and he makes every effort to come out ahead. This business is the only source supporting him and his big family. 

Mahfooz took out a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank in order to purchase enough fruits and vegetables to meet the demand of his clientele, since this will bring more profit to him and his family's conditions will improve accordingly. This loan will allow him to  build a good relationship with his clientele by serving their needs.

loans.use: to purchase enough fruits and vegetables to meet the demand of his clientele

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad is a 51-year-old married man who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his family. He is an active BRAC Pakistan borrower. Arshad’s wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. Since 2004, he has been running a uniform-selling shop which is the only source of income for his family. Currently, Arshad is interested in purchasing another shop to expand his business but finds this difficult due to financial constraints. 

Arshad is requesting a 200,000 PKR loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to pay for purchasing another shop. His loan will not only help him grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings. Arshad hopes to provide a quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase another shop

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Mr. Usman is a 28-year-old married man and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He has a wife and two children. Usman's wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife who always helps her husband. Since 2004, Usman has been running a cosmetics shop which is the only source of income for his family. Currently he is in need of purchasing more cosmetics products to expand his business, but due to financial constraints he finds it difficult. 

For that reason, he has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his cosmetics business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He desires to provide quality education to his children. He is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To pay for cosmetics for his shop.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is the mother of six children. She is living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a fruit seller and has sold fresh fruits from a shop in the nearby town for many years. He  offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through income generated from the fruit shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current enterprise. He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis so that he could generate maximum income out of the fruits sales.

Therefore, Kalsoom requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy extra seasonal fruits.

loans.use: To buy fresh and seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 44 years old, a married woman and mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Jamila has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and little bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Isapela

texts.en:
Isapela is a 32-year-old married woman with two children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Isapela has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weedkiller, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a spade. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Isapela hopes to save for her children's education and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weedkiller, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a spade.

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.es: Brenda, es una humilde mujer que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos, de los cuales solamente uno está estudiando, lamentablemente el mayor ya se dedico a trabajar por la situación económica  familiar, Brenda se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y tiene unas maquinas de video juegos con lo que se gana la vida, actualmente carece de productos para comercializar cosméticos, por lo que solicita este crédito con el fin de invertir con mas productos y así mejorar su economía, de paso también comprar más video juegos, así continuar aportando a los gastos familiares, con el préstamo comprara lo siguiente:  perfumes, vanidades,  rubores, lápiz labial, pinturas de uña  y video juegos.
texts.en:
Brenda is a humble woman who looks out for her children's wellbeing, only one of whom is in school. Unfortunately, the older one has to work due to the family's financial situation.  Brenda sells cosmetics and has a few video game machines from which she earns a living.  

Currently she doesn't have enough stock of cosmetics to sell and that is why she is requesting this loan. She will invest it in more products and thereby improve her financial situation. She will also buy more video games thus continuing to contribute to household expenses. With the loan she will buy the following: perfumes, makeup, blush, lipstick, nail polish and video games.

loans.use: to buy the following: perfumes, makeup, blush, lipstick, nail polish and video games.

loans.name: Jesus Wilfredo

texts.es: Jesús de 31 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Jesús se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace 8 años. Es muy conocido en la zona por ser una persona emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes, su casa está hecha a base de lámina y actualmente la cubierta del techo de su vivienda se encuentra dañado a causa de las lluvias y el sol, además desea construir un muro que proteja el corredor de su vivienda. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales como lámina galvanizada, madera, arena, ladrillo y cemento para reparar el techo y construir el muro citado.
texts.en:
31-year old Jesús lives in his own house with his wife and children. He has run a store for eight years and is well known in the area as an enterprising and hardworking person. His home is a very simple one made of metal sheets, and right now the roof is damaged because of the rains and sun. He wishes to build a wall to protect the passageway of his house.

Jesús is seeking a loan to buy materials such as galvanized sheeting, wood, sand, bricks and cement to repair the roof and build the wall.

loans.use: Buy galvanized sheeting, wood, sand, bricks and cement to repair his roof and build a wall

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis hace dos años, revisó sus ahorros y se dio cuenta que además de invertir en la compra de su propia vivienda, le alcanzaban para emprender un negocio que le generara ingresos. Así fue como observando con un amigo el mercado, percibió la necesidad de ofrecer servicios de alquiler de máquinas para lavar que le facilitaran a las familias, especialmente a las mujeres de hogar sus tareas diarias. Hoy se siente muy satisfecho de haber tomado esta decisión y quiere hacer crecer su negocio. Sus ventas las realiza diariamente, ofreciendo el servicio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Su meta es incrementar sus activos, para generar más ingresos y con ello continuar generando una mejor calidad de vida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará lavadoras que le ayudes a lograr la meta de incremento de sus ventas generadoras de nuevos ingresos, sueño de prosperidad que poco a poco conseguirá.
texts.en:
Two years ago, Luis took a look at his savings and realized that, besides investing in the purchase of his own home, he had enough to undertake a business to generate income.  So it happened that while watching a friend in the market, he realized the need to offer washing machine rentals to help families, especially housewives, with their daily chores.  These days he feels very pleased that he made that decision and wants to expand his business.

He makes his sales daily, offering his services from 8 in the morning until 8 at night.  His goal is to increase his inventory in order to generate more income and, with that, to continue creating a better quality of life.  Now he is applying for a Kiva loan, with which he will buy washing machines to help him reach his goal of increasing his income-generating rentals: a dream of prosperity that he will reach little by little.

loans.use: to buy washing machines to rent out.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun, 45, is married with two children who are going to school. She currently lives with her family in a remote area of Santuk district in Kampong Thom province. She is an industrious farmer who has been working in the agricultural sector for nearly 20 years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell after harvest season. With her earnings from farming, Savoeun is able to provide food for her family and allowances for her school-age children.

Currently, Savoeun’s family has an unhygienic latrine for use, so it can’t provide her family healthful living conditions. That’s why she is asking for a loan to build a safe, hygienic latrine to promote their health. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special rate. It has encouraged Savoeun to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: a loan to build a safe, hygienic latrine to promote their health.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Thim is a resident from a rural village of Baray district, Kampong Thom province. He is 34 years old, and married. He has one child, who still depends on his income and is attending to school. Being a responsible father, who aims to provide better living conditions, Thim works as a farmer growing rice on his own farm and is also involved in trading natural medicine for additional income. 

In order to improve his income, Thim would like to invest in the purchase of 5,000 Kg of rice to stock for future sales. Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for a loan from HKL to make the investment. 

Thim is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream, which is to build and expand his farming business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of 5,000 Kg of rice to stock for future sales.

loans.name: Synat

texts.en:
Synat is 32 years old and married with two children. She lives with her husband and children in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province, where she operates a farming business, growing a variety of vegetables and rice to sell. She has been a farmer for since 2010 and earns approximately $10.00 per day. 

To help her further develop her farming business, Synat is borrowing a loan to buy a cow for maintenance at the rice fields and to buy a water pump, which will be used to carry the water into her vegetable fields. Synat will continue working in her business in order to boost income for her family and provide them a better quality of life.

loans.use: o buy a cow for maintenance at the rice fields and to buy a water pump, which will be used to carry the water into her vegetable fields.

loans.name: Kheang

texts.en:
Kheang is a 29-year-old married woman. She has been blessed with two children, who completely depend on her income. To make a living, she runs her farm with the help of her husband. She primarily grows rice and cassavas to sell. Her husband, aside from helping her in farming activities, is also engaged in fishing in order to supplement to their income.

Kheang is requesting a loan to buy a cow for maintenance of the rice fields. She hopes to reduce the operating costs in renting others' animals and to yield better crops through the help of the loan. She is very delighted and thankful to all lenders.

loans.use: to buy a cow for maintenance of the rice fields.

loans.name: Mariel Fernanda

texts.es: La señora Mariel tiene 26 años y  2 hijos que son de las edades de 8 y 2 años, la señora Mariel  se dedica a la venta de distintos artículos como electrodomésticos, ella da los productos a crédito,   ella trae a pedido  desde la ciudad de Oruro semanalmente y los acomoda, ella vive en la zona de Sewencani, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Mariel  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería electrodomésticos al por mayor ya que estas fechas están muy requeridos. su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la cliente por la temporada de fin de año tiene que cambiar stock y mercadería,  la señora Mariel  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el tener que viajar para la compra de mercadería como también el tener que ir a cobrar a su clientela ya que en muchos casos no le pagan, va a utilizar los beneficios para tener un capital de trabajo para poder invertir y generar ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda de electrodomésticos donde pueda vender al por mayor y menor.
texts.en:
Mariel is 26 years old, and has 2 children who are 8 and 2 years old.  Mariel works selling various items such as household appliances, and she sells the products on credit.  She orders her inventory weekly from the City of Oruro.  She lives in the Sewencani zone.

This is her first cycle with the institution, and she intends to use the loan to purchase merchandise such as household appliances in bulk as they are in high demand during this time of year.  The reason why she is seeking this loan is since it is the end of the year, she needs to change her inventory.  Mariel faces challenges in her business such as the need to travel to purchase the merchandise, as well as having to go out to collect from her customers as in many cases, they do not pay her.  She will use the loan to increase her working capital to be able to invest in her business and generate revenues.  Her wish for her business is to have a household appliance store where she can sell in wholesale and retail.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as household appliances.

loans.name: Mshimba

texts.en: Mshimba is an industrious man who is making ends meet by doing farming. His previous loan helped him to buy pesticides for his business, and here again he comes to you requesting another loan of 50,000 KES to buy various seeds for planting during this season. He appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu at large.

loans.use: to buy various seeds for planting during this season.

loans.name: Ndoro

texts.en:
Ndoro is asking for a loan because he believes that through it, he will improve his business.

The previous loan enabled him to save money from his goat meat-selling business. He is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase goats for his business.

He feels that he was able to make a good investment with his previous loan, which to date has allowed him to maintain his level of profits to help his family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase goats for his business.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 23 years old, married to Irene and supports a family of two. He runs a butcher shop in Kapsabet. This has been his income-generating business for the last seven years, and he earns an average monthly income of 110,000 KES. 

He has borrowed a loan of 90,000 KES, and this is his second loan after paying the previous loan successfully. He plans to use the loan to purchase animals for slaughter and to sell the meat. 

He will use the profits from the business to repay the loan, save for his children’s school fees and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase animals for slaughter.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is married with two children who currently attend school. Her husband works abroad. 

Sharon’s first businesses were raising hogs and operating a junk shop. But, when she became tired of running these businesses, she decided to open her retail store.

Meanwhile, she received a small remittance from her husband working abroad. With regards to their situation, she decided to seek a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy grocery items such as noodles, toothpaste, shampoo, soap and conditioner to sell in her store.

She believes that this loan will enable her to earn higher income that will help her in sustaining her family needs.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as noodles, toothpaste, shampoo, soap and conditioner to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 41 years old and married with five children. 

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Margie has been farming sugarcane for four years and she also earns additional income from retailing rice in a general store. 

Margie is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ushauri Group

texts.en:
Ushauri is a Nuru International group of four farmers in the Kuria West District. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Ushauri collectively guarantee the loan.
Charles, who is raising up his hand, has been a member of this group for two years. He is 32 years old and is married with seven children, five of whom go to school. 

The loan from Kiva will enable him to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer which should increase his production of maize, sorghum and millet. Charles hopes to obtain enough food for his family and sell the surplus. He will invest the money from his sales which will later generate profits that will be used to pay school fees for his seven children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman who has been blessed with kids who attend school. For the past two years, she has raised and sold poultry. Margaret lives in her own house with electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Her greatest business challenge is disease outbreaks. Margaret joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Margaret is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase chicks and poultry feed. In the future, she dreams of becoming a poultry wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Nyanje

texts.en:
Nyanje runs a business selling goat meat. He used a previous loan to increase his business income and save money. Nyanje’s loan allowed him to maintain his profits and help his family meet their personal expenses.

Nyanje is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase more goats for his business. He believes his loan will improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a mother of four children. For years, she has operated a food-selling business, selling from home to neighbors and passersby. Mary lives with her family in their own house without electricity or running water. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mary is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar for her business. In the future, she dreams of establishing a big shop.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar

loans.name: Piru

texts.en:
Piru is a very hardworking and enterprising man who says that he has been able to greatly increase his income and help his family, thanks to his hard work.

He is asking for a loan to buy more gallons of petrol for resale.He joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of petrol for resale.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou is 30 years old and married with two children who are five and eight and presently attend school. She lives in Ganta and her husband is a businessman. For the past ten years, Kou has been selling bitter ball (African eggplant) at a market table. She makes a lot of profit as she is the only one who sells fresh bitter ball at the local market.

Kou is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter ball for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball to sell

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, preparing various foods such as rice, flat bread, and beans, and selling them to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the KES 5,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil for her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 41-year-old Aminata from Magburaka, Makeni Southern area, in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. 

Over a period of ten years, Aminata established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to contribute to taking care of her children. She works at the business ten hours per day and six days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more rice and general stock for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and general stock for resale.

loans.name: James      M

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old James from Masuba, Northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married with six children. Five of his children are currently attending school. In 1998, James established his clothing material business. He was a teacher but his salary was not enough to take care of his family, so he began his business to earn money to support his family. He works at the business from 7 am until 7 pm, 6 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is the high cost of transportation.

James requires a loan in order to buy more shirts, jeans and such for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business. In the future, James plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more shirts, jeans and other items for resale

loans.name: Nohn

texts.en:
Nohn is 45 years old and lives in Ganta. She is married and has five children between 9 and 22, who are currently in school and live at home. 

For the past three years, she has been selling peanuts in the local market. She has lots of customers and makes lots of profit since she is the only one who sells quality peanuts that are good for planting, especially during farming season. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more peanuts for her business.She plans to expand her business and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more peanuts for her business.

loans.name: Evi

texts.en:
Evi lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. Evi and four other family members live together in the family house. Evi is an entrepreneur who runs a small stall that sells soft drinks, snacks, cell phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. She joined Ruma because she was interested in expanding her business. Previously, she took a working capital loan from Kiva and she already paid it back on time. 

Evi is taking another loan from Kiva because she sees sales opportunities on weekends as more customers come to her small shop to buy mobile phone airtime credits. Over the last months, she has been able to process around 3-4% higher sales volume on weekends than on weekdays. Evi hopes that she can improve the small stall that she runs and put aside the extra cash for her family savings. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Madhubala

texts.en:
Madhubala is a young entrepreneur who is married and has two children (one son and one daughter).  She is 37 years old.  She is married to Profulla, who is a cycle-van puller.  Both the husband and wife are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their daughter got married and their son is engaged in a ply business. They live in the small village Barosoria in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own house.

Madhubala's husband earns for the family by carrying goods and people on his cycle-van.  His income is too small to maintain all the necessities of their family.  Madhubala and her son are engaged in a business of supplying ply in different plywood shops and wood factories. Ply is a layer of a folded or laminated material used in making plywood and wood furniture. They collect ply from their village and neighboring villages and supply it to different carpenters' shops and to the traders of wood.  They decided to expand their business by purchasing more raw materials. For that they need some capital.  

Madhubala has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase more ply to be able to supply more. The loan will help her work become more effective and efficient and therefore improve her services, which will continue to help her family and give them everything they need.

Madhubala hopes to generate more income and secure a better life from this business. She wants to purchase a mini truck in future to carry their goods to the market.

She appreciates and thanks her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase ply for the plywood business.

loans.name: Alpana

texts.en:
Alpana is 33 years old, married and raising one son, together with her husband Benu, 49 years old. They are from the small village of Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. They have a small kachha house (made of mud, straw and bamboo).  Both Alpana and her husband have primary education.  Their only son is a student in grade 8.

Alpana's husband is engaged in a small business and earns little, not enough to support the whole family.  He is the main source of income for the family, so Alpana has decided to start up a milk supply business and dairy products (milk, butter, paneer, curd, cheese etc.) business to help his husband to run the family well. She chose Kiva’s partner, BJS, for this loan as she wants to purchase a cow and she heard that they fund dairy farmers.  She hopes to earn a good profit from this business as there is a great demand for dairy products in her locality and in the present market.  She is also hopeful that with her efforts and dedication, she will improve her family's living conditions.

With the goal of starting the business, she has taken a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow.  She plans to use the income to further increase her business, as well as to save money for her son's education, and upgrade their kachha house to a pacca one( brick and concrete made).

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and start up a milk supply and dairy products business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 24 years old and her husband Bishu is 28 years old. Anna, Bishu and their three children (one son and two daughters) live in a kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo) in the small village of Raipara in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. Both Anna and her husband are uneducated and can only sign their names. All their children are receiving education and they are in grades 2,  5 and 6 respectively.

Anna's husband is a farmer.  He grows seasonable vegetables in their own land and sells them in the local market.  He is the only source of income for the family.  Anna also helps her husband in his agricultural work, after managing her household work.  Their economic condition is not running smoothly because her household expenses are gradually increasing day by day, specially the educational expenses of her children.  Both Anna and her husband are struggling to cover their family's basic needs.

Accordingly, Anna and her husband have decided to start potato cultivation on their farmland. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers. They will grow potatoes and after the harvest, they will sell them at the market. Anna knows that economic development is needed for a family so she is working hard to give support to her family.  She dreams of giving her children good education and building a pacca house (brick and concrete-made) with the profit generated from the business.

Anna is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 25 years old and is a single mother with one child. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and she receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land, Alice grows maize, beans, groundnuts, and cotton. She also has goats and chickens.

Alice has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. 

As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Alice will meet school requirements for her child and buy more land to grow more crops. 

Her biggest dream in life is to become a successful model farmer with the ability to free people in her community from poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 36 years old, and is married with four children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land, David grows maize, beans, vegetables, cassava, and bananas. He also has goats and chickens.

David has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years.

As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, David will meet school requirements for his children and set up demonstration gardens. 

His biggest dream in life is to become a model farmer and educate his children up to the university.

loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 46 years old and married. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is requesting a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business. He sells seasonal fruit from a donkey cart. He wants to buy oranges in large quantities to sell because they are in season and the prices are very low.
 
Kalsoom hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount to meet household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase oranges

loans.name: Jeneroze

texts.en:
Jeneroze is 27 years old and is married with two children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and she receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. On her land, Jeneroze grows maize, beans, coffee, vegetables, cassava, and bananas. She also has pigs, goats, and chickens.

Jeneroze has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. 

As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Jeneroze will buy more goats to expand her goat rearing project. Her biggest dream in life is to become a successful parent with her children educated up to the university.

loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Blanca Lorena

texts.es: Blanca de 36 años de edad  vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a buen precio con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, blanca esta solicitando un crédito para la  comprar de mas ropa interior por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Blanca is 36 years old, and lives with her four children and husband in a house that she owns.  She works selling underwear for women, men and children.  She is a traveling saleswoman and sells in the different villages and markets near her home.  She has a large customer base because her products are high quality and low-priced.  With the earnings from her sales and the help of her husband, they are able to cover their household expenses.  

Blanca is seeking a loan to purchase underwear in bulk  in order to increase her revenues so she can give her family a better quality of life with out any limitations.

loans.use: purchase more underwear in bulk for women, men and children.

loans.name: Mulimuli

texts.en:
Mulimuli is 30 years old and married with four children. She makes and sells fans, handbags, bangles and other items to earn a living. To earn extra income, she also has a taro and banana plantation and has been doing this for three years.

Mulimuli has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, pandanus leaves, materials and a sewing machine, and also chemicals and fertilizer.

She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, pandanus leaves, materials and a sewing machine, and also chemicals and fertilizer.

loans.name: Latea

texts.en: Latea is a 55-year-old woman who is married with 10 children. She runs a business selling tin fish, milk, sugar, salt, etc. in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Latea has requested a loan to buy milk, toilet paper, sugar, salt, mosquito coils, laundry soaps, laundry powder, snacks, cigarettes and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to provide financial support for her family and kids. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy milk, toilet paper, sugar, salt, mosquito coils, laundry soaps, laundry powder, snacks, cigarettes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Faalagi

texts.en:
Faalagi is a 22-year-old woman and is married with no children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro, cabbages, cucumber and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Faalagi needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, axe, spade, chemicals and bush knives. Faalagi will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrow, axe, spade, chemicals and bush knives

loans.name: Lepetia

texts.en:
Lepetia is a 51-year-old married woman with six children.

She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, yams and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

Lepetia has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, a crowbar, bush knives, a file, boots and a spade.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. With her profits, Lepetia hopes to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, a crowbar, bushknives, a file, boots and a spade

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is aged 44 and blessed with five children. She is working hard so that she can provide the needs of her family. 

She is engaged in a rice retailing business in their village. Her wish is to improve her business and make it more profitable.

She is now borrowing 10,000 PHP to purchase more sacks of grain and rice to resell.

She's hoping that her business will become more successful so that she can improve their status of living.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of grain and rice to resell

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is from Nyandarua South. He is 41 years old and married with three children who are between the ages of 2 and 12 years.

Elijah has a farming business that he has been doing for many years and has applied for his sixth loan which he intends to use to buy some mobile accessories to boost his secondary business. He is running a mobile business alongside farming. 

Elijah hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy mobile accessories.

loans.name: Monchita

texts.en:
Monchita is 71 years old and widowed with six children. Monchita works very hard to provide for them.

Monchita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, coffee, sugar, noodles, bread, etc., to sell.

Monchita has been in this business for 51 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, toothpaste, coffee, sugar, noodles, bread, etc. 

Monchita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, coffee, sugar, noodles, bread, etc., to sell

loans.name: Kazi Moto Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International Group of three farmers called Kazi Moto. They came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Joseph, who is holding up his hand, is 43 years old, married and has six children who all go to school. He has been a member of the group for three years now.

With his loan, Joseph envisions acquiring hybrid seeds and fertilizer for growing a ½ acre of maize and ¼ acre each of sorghum and millet. He hopes this will result in him having a good harvest that will ensure food security for his household, and he will also sell the surplus and spend the money in paying school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Victor's Group

texts.en:
Victor is a member of Amuka Group in Busia District.  He is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 39 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Victor has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving funds for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Victor is 62 years old and has been a farmer for 42 years.  Victor works as a farmer to provide for his 9 children.  The community and other farmers know Victor as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community activities such as the men's group and prayer group.  Victor described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Victor joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Victor joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family.  Because he likes being a leader, and he is an active community member, he wants to help more farmers. Victor has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Victor's life because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training and has more farm group support.  In the future, Victor hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to repair the home, save for the future and invest in a business.

Victor and the Amuka Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds

loans.name: Roxana Yaneth

texts.es:
Roxana de 18 años de edad, estudio solamente hasta noveno grado, dado a que se acompaño y no pudo seguir estudiando y decidió mejor poner un negocio. Esta acompañada, su pareja es vendedor de dulces, no tiene hijos y  viven con su mamá y una hermana. 


Ella tiene una venta de tostadas, yuca frita y enrredos en el patio de su casa , su mamá anteriormente se dedicaba a lo mismo y ella le ayudaba;  así es que desde muy pequeña hace este negocio  y no tiendo un estudio superior para poder trabajar se decidió por el negocio que actualmente desempeña, no tiene nada mas que esta actividad,  su horario de trabajo es de 2:00 p.m.  hasta las 6:00 p.m. 4 veces  a la semana.


Roxana ademas de lo que ya tiene, quiera hacer pupusas y el dinero del préstamo lo ocupara para comprar una plancha y comprar los materiales para la venta y hacer una galerita, pues teniendo un negocio mas fuerte y mas productivo aumentara sus ingresos y  mejorara su calidad de vida.


Los sueños de Roxana, es poder seguir estudiando y  hacer crecer su negocio junto con su familia, ella espera darle un futuro mejor a los hijos  que tenga y tener ella un futuro mejor y el préstamo le ayudara financieramente a lograrlo; las ganancias le ayudaran a ampliar el negocio y por medio de mucho trabajo y esfuerzo lo lograra.
texts.en:
Roxana, 18, left school after the ninth grade.  Already paired with a boyfriend then and unable to go on studying, she decided to start a business instead of moving on in school.  Her partner makes a living selling snacks.  She has no children and lives with her mother and a sister.


Roxana operates a food business, selling tostadas, fried yucca and enredos.  She works from her house and picked up the business from her mother who operated the business before.  She had always helped her mother so taking over the business made sense once she decided not to continue in school.  She has no other income and works this business from 2:00pm to 6:00pm, 4 days a week.


Roxana wants to add more dishes--specifically, pupusas--to her menu and she will use this loan to buy a press and the other supplies she needs to improve her small kitchen.  The investment will help her to build up the business and, in turn, increase her income.


For the future, Roxana would like to go back to school.  She also wants to continue building her business so that she can provide for any children she might have.  This loan will help her to meet her goals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is married and has children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a poultry business, selling eggs and chicks at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase chicken feed and medicine for the chicks in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and medicine for the chicks in her business.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
María, es madre soltera, vive junto a sus hijos y una hermana, sus amistades la motivaron a adquirir una moto taxi, la cual paga quien la maneje, hoy en día cuenta con  dos unidades, también tiene venta de repuestos para moto taxis, 
Comprará diferentes repuestos y terminara de pagar una de las moto taxi, le permitirá fortalecer el negocio de una forma rápida y así ofrecerá un mejor servicio a sus clientes, espera mejorara su economía para continuar dando a sus hijos una vida familiar más confortable.
María sueña con tener un negocio fortalecido y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
María is a single mother who lives with her children and one sister.  Her friends motivated her to purchase a motorcycle taxi, that the drivers pay her to use.  Today, she has two motorcycles, and she also sells replacement parts for motorcycles. 

She will purchase replacement parts and finishing paying for one of her motorcycles.  This will allow her to fortify her business quickly and offer better service to her customers.  She hopes to improve her finances so she can continue to provide her children with a more comfortable living situation.  María dreams of having a strong business and paying off her debts.

loans.use: purchase different parts and finish paying for one of her motorcycle taxis.

loans.name: Yain Kaain

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Yain Kain from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. Her children are currently attending school. After her wedding, Yain Kain established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create income to get her daily bread. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that at present her business is doing well.

Yain Kain requires a loan in order to purchase more plates, cups, and a variety of food containers. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future she plans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more plates, cups, and a variety of food containers

loans.name: Yah B.

texts.en:
Yah B. is 49 years old and lives in the Ganta area; she’s married with three children, aged 17 to 24. All live at home and attend school. 

For the past twenty years she has been baking and selling bread. Yah B. has requested a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, etc., in other to have her business turn into a bigger one. The problem she faces is the changing of Liberian dollars to US dollars. 

She started this business with money from her husband and learned this from friends.  What she likes about this business is that she makes new friends and meets people each and every day. It makes her proud of having money in her home every day. In future she wants to open a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, etc., in other to have her business turn into a bigger one.

loans.name: Teresa Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Teresa habitante de San Juan de la Concepcion, soltera madre de un hijo mayor de edad, que la apoya economicamente se dedica a la venta de Ropa por encargos, tiene aproximadamente 3 años de estar en esta actividad comercial, el credito lo solicita para la compra de Ropa para niños, jovenes y adultos ya que gracias a sus esfuerzos los clientes le han encargado en esta temporada, Agradece a Afodenic y Kiva el apoyo y confianza que le han brindado en este financiamiento.
texts.en: Doña Teresa lives in San Juan de la Concepcion.  She is a single mother with a grown son who helps her with expenses.  Doña Teresa has operated a clothing sales business for 3 years.  Thanks to her efforts, she has many orders to meet for the coming holiday season and she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the merchandise she needs to fill the orders.  She asked that we thank Afodenic and Kiva lenders for their support and confidence in extending this loan.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Upendo Self Help Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of two farmers and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Kennedy is holding up his hand.  He is 42 years old and married with eight children, and two of them go to school. He has been a member of this group for three years now.

Kennedy is asking for a loan to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer which is one way of implementing better farming methods that he has learnt through his group. He believes this would lead to increased yields. When he gets good yields of sorghum, millet and maize during the harvest of the 2014 long rains, he will be able to provide enough food for his family and sell the surplus. The money he gets from the surplus will be spent in paying school fees for his children in school.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, spices, etc.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, spices, etc.

loans.name: Virgen De Natividad I Group

texts.es:
La socia Gabriela  continua perteneciendo al banco comunal VIRGEN DE NATIVIDAD I,la socia Gabriela tiene 42 años de edad es soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus  actividades diarias con el negocio de salón de belleza, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio ,la socia realiza diferentes tipos de cortes y teñidos de caballo a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de tientes, tijeras entre otros.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de crianza de animales menores, venta de chicha de jora, venta de plásticos, venta de pasto, trabajador en construcción.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Gabriela continues to be a part of the Virgen de Natividad I communal bank.  Gabriela is a 42 year old single mother of two.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her beauty salon business.  She has worked in this business for a long time, and it has gone well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day.  She does different types of hair cuts and coloring for her clients.  She is a responsible and hardworking woman.  She hopes to continue working so she can continue to support her family.

The member is seeking this loan to purchase hair coloring supplies, scissors, and other supplies. 

The members who appear in the appended picture asked for permission to come to the meeting late due to work responsibilities.  The other members dedicate their time to raising animals, selling corn liquor, selling plastic, selling hay and working in construction.  The members is grateful for the loan and is committed to complying with the established payments.

loans.use: purchase hair coloring supplies, scissors, and other supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more ready-to-wear products needed for her business. The loan was helpful not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her accessory business was also helped by the loan that she acquired. Her income from her business assists in her everyday household expenditures. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Susan would like to apply for another 60,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear products and merchandise items, like polo shirts for men and women, socks, and shirts, in order to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. Having more items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to meet her family's daily needs and pay for her children's educational expenses. Susan looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Susan hopes to have more products to sell so that her business will grow bigger. She dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ready-to-wear products and merchandise, like polo shirts, socks, and shirts to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
A loan of PHP 7,000 is offered to Ronalyn to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy products every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as noodles, fish, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, bread and shampoo, with the loan. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels comfortable managing her business because she can earn money every day. Running a retailing business was very difficult to handle, but with her determination to become responsible enough, she believes that she works out her business to improve more and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy some additional supplies, such as noodles, fish, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, bread and shampoo, to sell.

loans.name: Bintiomari

texts.en: Bintiomari appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of 5,000 KES to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and vegetables for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables , wheat flour, maize flour, rice and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Posseh    M

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Posseh from Masuba, Makeni, in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married and has five children. In 2000, Posseh established her retail business. She was a housewife; she began her business because she was motivated by her colleague to run a business. She works at the business 15 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and proper business location.

Posseh requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and expand her business. In the future, Posseh plans to expand her business beyond expectation. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Yah

texts.en: Yah lives in Ganta area, Liberia. She is 49 years old, married, and has five children. Only two of her children are in school and live at home. She is a high school graduate. For the past 30 years she has been involved in business. Currently, she is selling rice, pepper, Maggi cubes (bouillon cubes), etc. She started this business by selling on a table at the market with a little money that she received from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, Maggi cubes, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children and to educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, Maggi cubes, etc.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en:
Akhtar is a 47-year-old lady. She lives with her husband and five children. She is taking a loan for her daughters because all of her daughters are experts in the art of embroidery. They are very expert in their professions and knit very fine bridal dresses. 

Due to demand, they are facing a shortage of material, which means they are unable to create their fine embroidery. Therefore, Akhtar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so she can buy raw materials for embroidery. With this loan, she will buy threads, fancy cloth, precious stones, sequins, and pearls in various colors. Akhtar is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 40 years old and is married with five children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. On his land, Peter grows maize, beans, cotton, vegetables, and bananas. He also has fish, goats, and chickens.

Peter has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. 

As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Peter will pay school fees for his children. His biggest dream in life is to own a large-scale business that will supplement his earnings from the sale of agricultural produce.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is 24 years old and is married with three children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and she receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On her land, Joseline grows maize, beans, coffee, vegetables, cassava and bananas. She also has goats and chickens.

Joseline has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. 

As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Joseline will buy school requirements for her children and invest in farming. 

Her biggest dream in life is to become a successful farmer and parent, and to be able to educate her children up to university and serve her community with agricultural information.

loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Memuna is 38 years old and married with 6 children; she runs a clothing material business in Masuba, the northern area in Sierra Leone.

She has been in this business since 2000, and sells different types of clothing material within a busy market area.  Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital and the high cost of the rental shop.

Memuna requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more clothing material to sell. 

She says the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business more than ever.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing material to sell.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio, es una persona que vive junto a su esposa y uno de sus hijos, en sus inicios fue empleado de una panadería, luego tomo cursos relacionados con la elaboración de pan, ya con mucha experiencia hace 15 años instalo su propia panadería, cuanta con 12 empleados que le ayudan salir con sus pedidos.
Con el crédito comprará azúcar, harina, levadura y mejorara la infraestructura de su local, con lo que espera mejorar la imagen del negocio, dar mejores condiciones de trabajo a sus empleados, aumentar su producción, seguir ofreciendo una fuente de empleo a sus empleados incrementar sus ventas y establecerse económicamente.
Sueña con fortalecer su negocio para tener los ingresos necesarios con los que cancelara su deuda, mejorara la alimentación, salud y vestuario de su familia.
texts.en:
Eladio and his wife have one child at home.  He went to work for a bakery many years ago, took classes to learn to make bread and then opened his own bakery.  He has operated the business for 15 years now and has 12 employees.  
Eladio will use part of this loan to buy the supplies he needs for baking--sugar, flour, yeast, etc.--and the rest to improve his workspace so that he and his employees have a better environment to work.  The investment will help him increase production and continue providing a means of employment for his workers.
For the future, Eladio wants to build his business further and generate an income that will allow him to pay past debts and better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his bakery business and pay for improvements to his workspace.

loans.name: Josue Daniel

texts.es: Josue de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su madre, el se dedica  a la venta de zapatos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado en un lugar muy estratégico donde circulan muchas personas por esa razón posee mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios, Josue esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas zapatos por mayor y asi poder surtir su negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes y generar mejores ganancias para tener junto a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Josue is 32 years old and lives in a home of his own with his wife and mother.  He sells shoes from a strategically located spot in the market where many people gather.  This is why he has many customers who prefer to buy from him because of the quality of his products and the good prices.  Josue is asking for a loan to buy more shoes in quantity and be able to stock his business, serve more customers and generate more income so he and his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes in quantity.

loans.name: Maria Mirian

texts.es: maria de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales y pupusas es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable siempre esta en busca de poder sacar adelante a su familia, ahora ella quiere mejorar su vivienda quiere colocar piso cerámico para poder tener mas limpia su casa, pero con lo que gana de sus ventas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de cerámica, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para poder realizar lo antes mencionado.
texts.en:
María is a 63-year old woman who lives in her own house with her family. She makes a living selling "tamales" (pasties made of corn) and "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas). She is very hardworking and responsible, and is always looking to provide for her family. 

She now wants to make improvements to her house and put ceramic floors that will keep the house cleaner. However, given that her income is not enough to cover the expenses that this would entail, she is requesting a loan to buy ceramic, cement and sand, and to cover labor costs.

loans.use: to buy ceramic, cement and sand, and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Sr. De Huanca De Coya Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE HUANCA DE COYA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Graciela ella es casada y tiene 48 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 p.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de tejidos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Sr. de Huanca de Coya communal bank.  This bank is located in the Coya district, Calca province, Cusco department.

Graciela, a member, is 48 years old.  She is married and has three children.  She works in her restaurant business.  She prepares different dishes like chicken with potatoes, soups, and ‘saltado de carne’ [a stir-fried Peruvian dish of meats and vegetables].  She works from 10:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She has had this business for seven years, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her restaurant business.

She is requesting the loan to buy products for cooking.  She will buy things like chicken, meat, and vegetables.

The other members devote themselves to the businesses of farming, selling woven goods, grocery store, and selling animals.

Graciela is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means.  She pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy products like chicken, meat, and vegetables for cooking.

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale is a hardworking and enterprising man who lives at the Coastal region of Kenya.He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past two years, he has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for his business has been unstable market prices. 

He joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  He is requesting a loan of  20,000 KES to purchase more goats.

loans.use: to purchase more goats.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina lives in Ganta. She is 26 years old, unmarried, and has three children between 2 months and 10 years old. Only two of the children are in school and they all live at home.
